campaign.story:
To our Canadian and other ROW fans: we're so sorry about the insane postal rates. The United States Postal Service is under attack. Unfortunately, that and the ongoing pandemic has resulted in the absurd rates you see reflected in the campaign. 
To our fans based in the USA: thousands of small businesses like ours depend on the Post Service everyday to stay in business.
Please consider signing this petition to save the United States Postal Service. 
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino and Bryan Valenza. Skies was launched in 2014 and has remained 100% independent through crowdfunding and the support of our fans. For the first time ever we're publishing two issues in one year!
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to print the seventh issue of Skies of Fire. Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of future editions of the series.
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.
In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.
Issue Three follows the pair as they recruit members for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead.
In Issue Four, the crew of the Zephyr comes together despite their differences.
Issue Five follows the Zephyr as they embark into the Expanse.
Issue Six finds the Zephyr in enemy territory deep in the heart of the storm. 
In Issue Seven, the Zephyr attempts to complete the mission.
The creative minds behind Skies of Fire and Mythopoeia, Vincenzo Ferriero  and Ray Chou have been collaborating on creative projects since 2008 despite living 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art.
Bryan Valenza is a prolific artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects from top publishers in the industry. 
---------------------------------
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.
Gregory Shipp and I am a freelance fantasy and historical cartographer based in the UK. He is the cartographer of issue #7's codex document. 
The majority of funds from this Kickstarter will go into covering the cost of printing issue #7 and fulfilling orders from this Kickstarter. Any remaining money will be put back into further production of Skies of Fire.
Skies of Fire Book I is a 8x11" clothbound hardcover with 120 pages including sequentials, codex documents, and variant covers.. The book features a new wraparound cover by Pablo de Bonis featuring the city of Monterey.
Like our previous single issues, Skies of Fire #7  will be an 8x11 saddle-stitched floppy comic with 38 pages of interiors.
The Variant for Issue #7 features an original front and back cover oil painting of the First Battle of Ryder's Peak by award winning aviation artist Keith Burns. The preview image does not do the illustration one bit of justice! 
Each physical copy of Skies of Fire #7 will also include an 8x11 print of the artwork packed in.
We're debuting a new set of Desertlands Postcards from Dimitris Martinos! 
Each physical copy of Skies #7 will come with a random postcard similar in style to his previous set, the Lowlands War:
We Own The Sky Badge
Add-Ons can be purchased during the time of our post campaign surveys via our fulfillment partners at BackerKit. If you'd like to purchase your add-ons during the campaign, please add the following to your pledge amount (S&H included):
Digital Posters - $15

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 13th campaign and third of the year. We have a fairly well tread pipeline from production to publication at this point. The only risk is in delays - the book is completely finished, but we still need to print and ship them out. 

Last time around COVID19 slowed us down by an extra month. This time we'll try to close out the campaign once again within two months, which we've so far have managed in around three of our campaigns. The other ones have taken a little bit longer, but in general our arc is towards faster fulfillment and delivery rather than slower. 

The United States Postal Service is under threat by the current administration. We have witnessed firsthand massive delays and rapidly fluctuating shipping rates in the last three months as a result. All signs point to this instability in this vital service increasing as we get closer to the elections in Fall. Thousands of small businesses like ours that depend on USPS for service are at risk. Please consider signing the petition to save our Postal Service linked at the beginning of the campaign and make sure to vote this upcoming November. 

As always, we have a 100% satisfaction guaranteed policy with our backers. Please never hesitate to contact us with questions, comments, and critique. We take everything in mind and are always looking to improve.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
$15k - Stretch Goal Unlocked! 
All physical packages will now come with Stonehand Badge! The badge is the iconography of the Stonehand Tribe of the Wastes and with Nymeran Calligraphy "Five as One" written underneath the stone hand. 
Approximately 2x2" in size. Designed by Hamm Liu
Glow is an ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Anny Maulina and Dia Jia.
Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world.
With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world. Until one day the Towers fell.
The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain.
Issue One introduced us to Caszy and Koken, siblings scavengers of the Wastes with extraordinary abilities.
Issue Two continues the story as the witch Myra makes a compelling proposition.

Issue Three explores the aftermath of a misunderstanding.
In Issue Four, the town of Shoddai is given an ultimatum. 
Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Niamh Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger.
Nymeran is used a number of ways in the comic, including sound effects.
Each digital edition of Glow comes with a language guide that unlocks the secrets of ancient Nymeran.


Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they’re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London.
Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia and creator of the webcomic Raruurien. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her on Patreon and DeviantArt.
Dia Jamandron was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She currently works for Wild Canary Animation . Check her out on instagram!
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Witchblade. @bryan_valenza
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.
Niamh Doyle is a from Ireland and with a background in linguistics and teaching, Niamh works in financial crime compliance. In her spare time she likes to play a board game or two.
Hammond Liang is a self taught illustrator who often goes by the name of "Hammling." Growing up in a tiny apartment in Chinatown NY, he always had a fascination in all things art. From martial arts to dance to illustration, he combines all of his experiences to bring motion and life to his artwork. You can find him on Art Station and Instagram.
Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! crocodev
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. He helped bring together many of the technological designs found in Glow. http://wingsofwrath.deviantart.com/
The budget for this Kickstarter is extremely straightforward, with most of the funds going into printing our physical issues and reward fulfillment.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 12th crowdfunding campaign and fourth one in the Glow series. The main risk is in delays regarding fulfillment. We try to fulfill our projects within two months of closing the campaign. Sometimes we're right on the money, but sometimes it takes us a little longer. Nonetheless, we're adamant about 100% customer satisfaction. If you have a problem just ping us and we'll take care of it!

We're sorry about International Shipping. We wish we could offer the rewards shipped at a lower price, but alas shipping rates have only gone in one direction over the years.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hi! My name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel series Girrion. This campaign is specifically for funding the creation of Issue #13  which is in the first half of Volume 2 of the overall story. (~pages 299 - 323 .)
New to the story? Not to worry! Any Issue from 1 - 13 will be available in this campaign.
Thanks to the amazing Kickstarter community I've had Issues #2 - 12 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
Issue 1 Cover Art
Issue 13 Cover Art in progress

 GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldly magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially, it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships, and environments.
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. When I would draw environments or characters the ideas would just pop in my head. One scene led to another, then another, etc. It took a lot of time, but the experience put in over the years not only helped the art, but it also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
A lot of influences on my work come from 80/90's films/animations/comics. I remember really feeling transported to these fascinating worlds. Films like Star Wars and Macross really created exciting unique places that felt real. In this age of digital effects, I feel like some of this time that went into creative development is going into special effects. Something has been lost and many sci-fi stories feel hollow, at least for me. Girrion is a lot about just trying to make a new world that feels real.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
Volume 1 Hardcover
If you would like to get a closer look at the different book formats available I have a youtube video here.
 How Do Add-Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) Add the total of your Add-On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
 EXPENSES
Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.

You can also follow the project at:
twitter.com/TomLintern1

Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience, the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job– sometimes more than others. I work freelance so it changes depending on the projects that come up.

campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino and Bryan Valenza. Skies was launched in 2014 and has remained 100% independent through crowdfunding and the support of our fans. For the first time ever we're publishing two issues in one year! 
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to print the sixth issue of Skies of Fire. Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of future editions of the series.
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.
In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.
Issue Three follows the pair as they recruit members for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead.
In Issue Four, the crew of the Zephyr comes together despite their differences.
Issue Five follows the Zephyr as they embark into the Expanse.
While Issue Six takes place in the heart of the storm....
The creative minds behind Skies of Fire and Mythopoeia, Vincenzo Ferriero  and Ray Chou have been collaborating on creative projects since 2008 despite living 5,437 miles apart. 
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art.
Bryan Valenza is a prolific artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects from top publishers in the industry.

 Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army.
Catalin Lartist was born in the plains of Wallachia, a descendant of Vlad the Impaler, and learned the art of pencil and ink from an old master and book keeper.In his years of apprenticeship in the Chronicles Keep he learned the wisdom of the dead and brought back the old mastery of hypnotic drawing.He uses his knowledge to steal people's souls and seal them on paper.
The majority of funds from this Kickstarter will go into covering the cost of printing issue #6 and fulfilling orders from this Kickstarter. Any remaining money will be put back into further production of Skies of Fire.
Skies of Fire Book I is 8x11" clothbound hardcover with 120 pages including sequentials, codex documents, and variant covers.. The book features a new wraparound cover by Pablo de Bonis featuring the city of Monterey.
Like our previous single issues, Skies of Fire #6  will be an 8x11 saddle-stitched floppy comic with 38 pages of interiors.
 This issue's variant will be a homage to Herge's Tin-Tin featuring Alex and Baron!
Stay tune as we announce our Variant artist mid campaign! 

We Own the Sky Badge
 Add-Ons can be purchased during the time of our post campaign surveys via our fulfillment partners at BackerKit. If you'd like to purchase your add-ons during the campaign, please add the following to your pledge amount (S&H included):
Digital Posters - $15
Digital Art Prints - $20
Individual Issues - $15
Variant #6 - $20
Papercraft Model - $20
Set of Postcards - $10
Archival Art Print - $25
Poster - $30
Badge - $15
We're happy to announce that should we reach our ultimate stretch goal of $30,000, we'll commission a new set of five postcards from fan favorite Dimitris Martinos! 
Skies of Fire #4 Variant by Dimitris Martinos.
Dimitris worked on the variant cover for issue #4 as well as the Tales of the Lowlands Postcard set. If we hit the goal, we'll include a random postcard in each physical package.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 10th Kickstarter campaign. The biggest risk is in timely fulfillment. We will do our best to fulfill all orders within two months of the campaign's close. Otherwise, the production of the book is finished and it's ready to go. We're confident that the risk to you as a backer is minimal. We're committed to 100% satisfaction when it comes to our campaigns. Just ask our previous backers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Folks! 
So here's where we're at.
Skies of Fire #7
We're on the last two coloring passes, to be hopefully wrapped up by Mid-May.

Hey Folks,
Happy February! 
Big couple of weeks for us coming up! Here's the latest:
European Shipping

Hey Folks! 
I shipped all NA packages and have been dealing with customer stuff. If you have an issue please let me know and we'll take care of it asap! Vince is in the process of shipping books to Europe so be on the lookout for those soon as well! 
Variant Cover

Hey Everyone,
Just a heads up with regards to shipping - we have about 35 individual NA orders still left to go which should go out early next week. Europe should be all set to begin shipping next week as well. A couple of minor bits and ends too:
If you've been tracking your order but haven't seen it move, don't worry. We printed a bunch of labels earlier but shipped them out later.

Hey Everyone,
Hope you all had a wonderful holiday season! 
We unfortunately  found ourselves a bit jammed these past couple of weeks so had to delay shipping until today.  We're sorry for the delay, but we also didn't want any shipments to get lost over the congested holiday period.

Hey Everyone! 
Happy to announce that we launched our BackerKit surveys today! 
Fulfillment

Hello Everyone! 
We've been hard at work behind the scenes getting ready to fulfill this campaign. This time around is taking a little longer because along with the typical printing and logistics associated with a campaign, we've also recently incorporated as a company!
That's right! Vince and I are officially Mythopoeia, Inc. That's required a lot of paperwork, and more importantly for the sake of this campaign, a creation of a new business account and transfer of our existing assets onto new cards, etc.

campaign.story:
Glow is an ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Anny Maulina and Dia Jia. 
Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world.
 With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world. Until one day the Towers fell.
The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain.
Issue One introduced us to Caszy and Koken, siblings scavengers of the Wastes with extraordinary abilities.
Issue Two continues the story as the witch Myra makes a compelling proposition.
While Issue Three explores the ramifications of the misunderstanding between Caszy and Myra. 
Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Colm Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger.
Nymeran is used a number of ways in the comic, including sound effects. 
Each digital edition of Glow comes with a language guide that teaches you the secrets of ancient Nymeran. 
Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they’re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London.
Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia and creator of the webcomic Raruurien. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her on Patreon and DeviantArt. 
Dia Jamandron was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She currently works for Wild Canary Animation . Check her out on instagram!

Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Witchblade. @bryan_valenza
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.


From Ireland, Colm Ó Dúill is a verification specialist at TransferWise's office in Tallinn, Estonia, where he has lived since 2007. He holds an M.Phil. in Applied Linguistics and a B.Comm with French, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Linguistics. He is married with two children, and has been dabbling in creating constructed languages since 2005; Nymeran is his first developed constructed language.
Hammond Liang is a self taught illustrator who often goes by the name of "Hammling." Growing up in a tiny apartment in Chinatown NY, he always had a fascination in all things art. From martial arts to dance to illustration, he combines all of his experiences to bring motion and life to his artwork. You can find him on Art Station and Instagram. 

Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! crocodev
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. He helped bring together many of the technological designs found in Glow. http://wingsofwrath.deviantart.com/
The budget for this Kickstarter is extremely straightforward, with most of the funds going into printing our physical issues and reward fulfillment.

This is our 9th campaign and we like to think we've gotten pretty good at this! The biggest risk is timely fulfillment. We always strive to fulfill our campaigns as soon as possible, but sometimes manufacturing and production issues can delay certain orders or products, holding the entire process up. This campaign all of the items have been designed and we're sourcing our manufacturing partners locally to speed up turnaround and hopefully have everything to you by the end of August. Hey Folks,
An overall shipping update this week! Here's where we stand:

Hello Everyone,
I'm happy to announce that as of today shipping is underway! We have inventory on both continents and have begun batch shipping as many as we can.  I started shipping NA and Vince will start shipping Europe soon as well. 
 ARCANE SALLY & MR. STEAM

Hey Folks,
Just a quick update for today. This week I've been contacting various printers to work out what the best permutation would be for us to fill out our backlog. In addition to printing Glow #3 (which was ordered a while ago), we need to reorder issues #1-2 split across the UK/USA. We think the best way may be to use multiple printers located in each geographic region, so we've been working on that.

Folks we did it! 
Thank to you we get to keep making Glow! Woohoo! 
This particular campaign was a challenge in a lot of ways. I wrote in one of the earlier updates about how I think the thumbnail for the project during the first 72 hours might have been a bit of a bungle on our end. I know by a lot of measures this campaign was a huge success, but I guess when you've been at it for a little bit like we have there's always some intangible goalpost that needs to be climbed because some part of us always wants more, right? Bigger, better, stronger, faster!  Ah-go-go-go-go!

campaign.story:
//TLDR: Nightfall is a hybrid of Narrative Artbook and Graphic novel set in world of The Future is Now, an original cyberpunk universe.
[The video ends and the lights go up - You are in a room with Max Overload, notorious ex-member of Und3ad and the Enemies of Reality, and H4wk-ki which you don't know but Max assures you 'is all right'] 
Max Overload: Yeah, that video was broadcast about six months ago, things got really grim afterwards. Now Robo-City Prime lies in even more chaos, fear and confusion. Nothing works, all systems and services are down, the Robo-President is gone and so are the Ministers. Sai and the Enemies of Reality are nowhere to be found, The Machine is silent... we are on our own.
H4wk-Ki: And we need your help. We need everybody to rally and start working together. We must let them know that there is a future and what we have sacrified to get here.
Max Overload: Exactly, we must unite and rebuild. For now, to convince the population, we will use the tool we know better: Propaganda. It is time to form The New Ministry of Information.
H4wk-Ki: Of course one of our first tasks is to let everyone know that the New Ministry is not like the old one, this one is created to serve the people - human, robot or mutant alike. We will tell them about the events of Nightfall, they need to know the true story. There is a lot of work to do, so let's not waste time. Should you agree to join the New Ministry, we have prepared a portable Deathburger Unit that will brief you on the details.   
[SYNCRONIZING WITH DBB378... STAND BY...COMPLETE]
Deathburger_Unit B378:  Welcome Agent, to the New Ministry of Information [N.M.I.] I've prepared the visual material you need to review for this operation. Updated - The New Ministry has distributed more than 120.000 propaganda units and has taken control of the Halls of The Machine, High Plaza, Darnytsia, Jinshan Park, Sivatoshyn, Baoshan and Neon Town districts. All Agents are now assigned to Holosi IV district. 
[LOADING NEW MINISTRY PROGRESSION DISPLAY] 
Deathburger_Unit B378: The mission of The New Ministry is to rebuild Robo-City Prime and help its Robo-Citizens. We will do so by taking control of one district at a time, and every time we take control of a district you will unlock an additional piece of Agent Equipment.
Unlocked rewards are added to all ranks. The Digital Agent rank gets a digital version of the unlock.
UNLOCKED EXTRAS:
 40K - SLIPCASE UPGRADE: All book copies are upgraded with a slipcase.
 50K - TWO PINS: Set of two enamel pins. 
 65K - TWO POSTERS: Two A3 size Posters
 80K - SVIATOSHYN: Set of two stickers and two patches.  
 100K - BAOSHAN: Original Soundtrack for Nightfall (Digital)
 120K - NEON TOWN: Three character cards, content decided by backers.
 SSG - SSG-Beacon-F200© : Extra print by a guest artist // 200 FB shares reached.
 SSG - SSG-EMP-T200© : Eight additional stickers, to create a sticker pack.
 IN PROGRESS - HOLOSI IV: Soundtrack in Cassette or CD
To accomplish your assignment, as an Agent you will be granted a copy of The Future is Now: Nightfall. You will distribute this propaganda material so every Robo-Citizen is informed and knows the truth about the events of Nightfall.
Nightfall is part of The Future is Now universe. The book is a sequel to Neon Rising and continues the story right where Neon Rising ended. [If you need to catch up you can check the digital version of Neon Rising for free at: Digital - Use the code hypetrain62k19 at checkout] // Nightfall is a hybrid of narrative artbook and graphic novel.
[CREATING HYPER REALISTIC SIMULATION] 
There are four different type of pages in Nightfall:
 A - Full page illustration, silent.
 B - Semi sequence narrative, usually silent.
 C - Full narrative, with dialogue.
 D - Gimmick page or meta [a diorama of a location, the view on a screen, a POV, etc] 
Nightfall is divided into five chapters and each chapter has about 22 pages. Every chapter is composed of a combination of any number of these type of pages depending on the narrative developments for each chapter. 
For example: A-A-A-B-C-C-C-B-A-A-A-A-D-B-C-C-C-C-A-A
[DEPLOYING CONTENT PREVIEW] 
NIGHTFALL PREVIEW GALLERY
NEON RISING [THE PREVIOUS BOOK] CHAPTER PREVIEW
BRIEF FUTURE IS NOW LORE BREAKDOWN

Depending on your contribution you will be given a rank and a title in the New Ministry. You will receive an Agent Equipment Set according to your rank.

Deathburger_Unit B378: Agent, there are still a few extra things that you need to know. I have enabled a J.O.S.A.N [Jigsaw Operating System and Autonomous Network] subroutine that will answer to any remaining questions that you might have.

J.O.S.A.N. about quality: Quality is the main goal when producing the book and the rewards. We already have a chain of suppliers ready to attend to the demands that will arise from this campaign. I like to produce locally and work with supplier that meet ethical and ecological standards. To keep transparency, as Agents, you will be informed about who and where every item is produced. The current edition of Neon Rising has been printed at Agpograf [In my opinion the best printer in Barcelona] and they will print Nightfall as well. Owners of the most recent edition of Neon Rising can vouch for its quality.

J.O.S.A.N. about shipping: We will use the same shipping system we use at Citadel 9 at the moment. All rewards will be shipped by courier [When custom laws allow it, Russian Federation and Brazil might need a different service] granting detailed tracking and a swift delivery. Shipping rates are calculated by weight, while the rates might seem slightly high keep in mind these are heavy books. Neon Rising weights 1.5kg and Nightfall with similar specs will be around that. Most rewards will be close to 4kg and that is a factor on the rates. 

With a project like this there is always a lot of factors to take into account and the chance of unexpected events. Any problem can be overcome with good planning and forecasting. The current delivery date of October 2020 is an estimate, consider that it might be modified depending on the final results of the campaign, such as unlocks and total number of backers.

Communication is a central part of this operation, making sure Agents are always informed and updated about any changes or news regarding the progress of Nightfall.

Small note about Citadel 9: it is basically a small publisher run by me [DBB378/JOSAN] located in the Barcelona area. I ran a very successful and highly praised campaign for what is now Neon Rising and I've shipped more than eight thousand books in the last couple years, plus hundreds of carefully produced T-shirts, posters and other merchandise.

campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino and Bryan Valenza. Skies was launched in 2014 has remained 100% independent through crowdfunding and the support of our fans. Last year we created a beautiful clothbound hardcover trade edition collecting our first four issues. This year, we're back with the second half of the series! 
This campaign's goal is to raise funds to print the fifth issue of Skies of Fire. Any additional funds will be funneled back directly into the production of future editions of the series. 


Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.  

In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.  

In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.  

Issue Three follows the pair as they recruit members for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead. 

In Issue Four, the crew of the Zephyr comes together despite their differences. 
Issue Five follows the Zephyr as they finally embark on their mission into the Expanse...



Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou have been creating stories together since 2008. They met in college and continue to collaborate despite being 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art. 
Bryan Valenza is a prolific artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects from top publishers in the industry. 

Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army.    
Josephe Vandel is a German cartographer and graphic designer with a love for RPGs and creating fictional worlds.
 The majority of funds from this Kickstarter will go into covering the cost of printing issue #5 and fulfilling orders from this Kickstarter. Any remaining money will be put back into further production of Skies of Fire. 
Skies of Fire Book I is 8x11" clothbound hardcover with 120 pages including sequentials, codex documents, and variant covers.. The book features a new wraparound cover by Pablo de Bonis featuring the city of Monterey. 
Skies of Fire Book I. Collects the first four issues. 8x11, Clothbound, 120 Pages. Includes past covers and variant documents.
Interior of Book I featuring issue four.
Like our previous single issues, Skies of Fire #5 will be an 8x11 saddle-stitched floppy comic with 38 pages of interiors.  
Skies of Fire single issues are beautiful oversized 8x11 comic books printed.
This issue's featured variant cover features the dark and gothic work of  Gabriela Bacila. 
The illustration will depict the two elder gods, Nihil and Amika, raging against their eternal prison walls that form the Expanse. 
The full variant will be revealed towards the middle of the campaign. 
Collector's Edition Limited Bookplate (numbered out of 1000).
Zephyr Papercraft Model designed by Guardadobosque.
Add-Ons will be handled post campaign by our partners at Backerkit. You will be able to select additional a la carte items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information. Funds in excess of your chosen reward tier can also be used to purchase add-ons in Backerkit. If you have a specific question about an add-on, please don't hesitate to directly message us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our eighth crowdfunding campaign. In every case we've been dedicated to fulfilling what we've promised at all costs. The biggest risk associated with this campaign is a delay on estimated shipping times. We have not yet printed the comics for Issue #5, and in the event of unforeseen circumstances the books may take longer to arrive in our hands.

We're doing our best to decrease the time between campaign end and shipping. In the past we've been as good as fulfilling in under two months - that's our goal for this campaign, and we're confident we can achieve it.

Original Pages and Commissions will be going out in October as we prepare to head back to Vegas, so please let us know of any address changes – though we will also be sending messages as a reminder.
ALL Kickstarter backers will also be receiving FREE additional items as a sincere Thank You! for being so patient while we have worked on all of this.
October will be our last month on the road, and we’ll be back to regularly sharing artwork again by as early as next week.

Hey everyone, Oliver here.
You may have seen the update we did a few days ago regarding an offer to get the Omnibus from our live Indiegogo campaign. It came to our attention that:
You cannot change the amount of money you give for a perk on Indiegogo, including the Donation tier
There's no text field on the Vol. 4 survey to leave a note saying that you want to switch your contribution here to an Omnibus on Indiegogo

updates.update_content:
What a crazy month, week, and day this has been!!!!  I'm genuinely still in shock and don't even know how to begin to thank everyone for all of this.  
Although I'm exhausted and possibly delirious, the sheer joy I'm feeling at this moment goes far beyond anything I could ever express - and none of this would be possible without you.
Thank you for making this insane Kickstarter experience feel like a collaboration between family and friends. You have all sacrificed so much to make this possible, and after more than 20 years of pouring myself into this project, you just can't imagine what that means to me - and what it means to everyone on the team.

campaign.story:
The Pipers is a graphic novel illustrated by Paul du Coudray and Beth Haidle, based on a science-fiction story that Philip K. Dick wrote in the 1950s.
About Kickstarter Rewards
About the Story
The Pipers is based on a short story by Philip K. Dick, who wrote over 100 short stories and over 40 books — many of which are responsible for films such as Blade Runner, Minority Report, Total Recall and The Man in the High Castle.
About the Creators
We are siblings! We were born 18 months apart in Portland, Oregon to parents who self-published over 20 books — books are in our blood! Paul du Coudray is a designer / artist / illustrator living in Taos, New Mexico. Beth is an author, speaker, and illustrator living in Portland, Oregon. She has illustrated books such as Before They Were Authors, I, Parrot, and The Girl Who Named Pluto.
Why Print?
Mascot is publishing books as a way of creating 'artifacts' and some artifacts deserve to be held. We also recognize that making a book requires resources and the actual impact of consuming resources is exponentially more complicated than just what goes into making a book. As we strive to make all printed works as tree-worthy as possible, we are additionally donating money for at least 1 tree to be planted per printed book.
Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter is the perfect platform to fund the completion and printing of this book, and offers us the ability to produce books for exactly how many people would like to buy them! We already have a print broker lined up, a warehouse in Colorado ready for shipping & fulfillment — so why are we asking for money? We want to know how many books to print for you! One of the most exciting things about this project is that we are done... with the WHOLE book... let's go to print!
Affordability
We're offering an e-book for international supporters because shipping books outside of the U.S.A. is crazy expensive. We also want to make this book accessible to anyone in the world, and to honor the rights-free status of Philip K. Dick’s story. If for any reason you can’t afford the print version and don’t have a dollar to spare for the digital version, you can direct message Paul on Instagram when the Kickstarter is over and we’ll send you a link for free download.
Gifts
Do you want to give this as a gift to someone for the holiday or just because? Send the following link, or download the PDF to give to loved ones while they await the book in the mail! Check it out:

https://www.mascot.studio/gift
Timing
When the Kickstarter ends we'll know how many books to print and we'll place an order shortly thereafter! The process of printing takes about 3 months, so you could expect your book(s) sometime in early Spring :-)

Studio Mascot, founded by Paul du Coudray, is growing up to be a group of practitioners who are exploring a variety of themes within multiple mediums.

Mascot Press • A small press devoted to important works. We have several more books planned for 2019.

Mascot Films • We are working on a couple of film projects, ranging from animated films to documentary style.

Mascot Foundry • Our mini-foundry was created in order to share the hand-written fonts that we use in our projects with other artists. Why? Because most of the hand-written fonts out there suck. We hope ours don’t suck and that you enjoy using them.

updates.update_content:
Dearest Backers,
Finally! Thanks for your patience as we battled many setbacks this year... from correcting cover errors to unexpected Trump tariffs on China (which hit us hard on delivery by sea?!). Nonetheless, the books have safely arrived at our fulfillment warehouse in Colorado. 
Printed rewards will start shipping as soon as I hand over the final backer report, so please take a moment and update your mailing addresses if necessary and we'll get the mailing started!

Hello! Good news... I received a bundle of finished books this morning. The covers look great and I can't wait to get the final rewards out to everyone. The rest of the 1,000 books have been in transit for awhile now and are scheduled to arrive at the warehouse in another few weeks. I'll post another note here as books and other rewards begin to leave the warehouse to all backers. Thanks again for your patience. 
- Paul

updates.update_userinfo: Printed Rewards: Cover Delays, but back on track
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers, 
With all of the books in boxes and set to sail, I had to make a tough decision and pull them out and re-do the covers, which were off-center and not to spec. I didn't feel right coming this far and shipping out anything less than intended. The good news is, I have the final copy in hand, and the interior is beautiful and I think you're going to love it.
Re-printing has delayed us a few weeks, but we are back on track and I expect...

As the wait continues for getting final books to mail out, I thought I'd share a few photos of what the color looks like on the fancy paper we chose... it's looking good!  Thanks for your patience, everyone.

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Rewards: Final rewards for all backers!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
Printed full-color proofs are still underway, and last week I was mailed a dummy (blank copy) to demonstrate cover, spine and paper quality. I compared it to a few other books in my library and am pleased with the quality... and hope you will be too! 
For anyone wanting to geek out about paper, here are the specs:

updates.update_userinfo: Printed Rewards: the Hardcover Edition continues through the proofing process
updates.update_content: Good news: the final book was submitted to the print brokers last week and we are waiting on multiple quotes to compare. Once we decide on a printer, the page thickness will determine the spine width and then we'll submit the final cover and we're done!  In the meantime, we are looking into additional eBook formats for the PDF and putting together distribution for digital rewards.  :-)

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Rewards: the Ebook for The Pipers is here!
updates.update_content:
We've finished resizing and adjusting the book! All of the text is now getting a final pass for sizing, color and placement. Once this is finished we will be able to submit the final PDF to the printers and begin getting quotes. Then we'll set to work sending out digital rewards to all backers. 
Thanks for your patience!

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel Girrion. This campaign is specifically for funding the creation of Issue #11  and 12 which are at the beginning of Volume 2. (Pages 251 - 298 in the overall story.)
New to the story? Not to worry! All of Volume 1 is available in this campaign as well. 
Thanks to the amazing Kickstarter community I've had Issues #2 - 10 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
 GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldly magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
Artwork in progress
In issues 11 and 12 Jarra is finally setting foot outside of Winchwing. He wakes up and finds himself in strange surroundings aboard a giant ship brimming with the very pirates that invaded his city. He knows he must escape as soon as possible but even with all his hi-tech gadgets at his disposal-- it's not going to be that easy.
ABOUT THE BOOK
Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially, it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships, and environments.
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. When I would draw environments or characters the ideas would just pop in my head. One scene led to another, then another etc. It took a lot of time, but the experience put in over the years not only helped the art, it also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
A lot of influences on my work come from 80/90's films/animations/comics. I remember really feeling transported to these fascinating worlds. Films like Star Wars and Macross really created exciting unique places that felt real. In this age of digital effects I feel like some of this time that went to into creative development is going into special effects. Something has been lost and many sci-fi stories feel hollow, at least for me. Girrion is a lot about just trying to make a new world that feels real.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
If you would like get a closer look at the different book formats available I have a youtube video here.
How Do Add-Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) Add the total of your Add-On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
All Hardcover orders come "deluxe" automatically.
EXPENSES
Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:
Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience, the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job– sometimes more than others.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Glow is an ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Anny Maulina and Dia Jia. 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise print funds for issue #2. Any additional funds will go directly towards the production of further issues of the series. 
Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world.
 With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world. Until one day the Towers fell.
The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain.
Issue One introduced us to Caszy and Koken, siblings scavengers of the Wastes with extraordinary abilities.
Issue Two continues the story as the witch Myra makes a compelling proposition.
Variant Cover illustrated by Melissa Pagluica. Image links to her website.
Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Colm Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger.
Nymeran is used a number of ways in the comic, including sound effects. 
Each digital edition of Glow comes with a language guide that teaches you the secrets of ancient Nymeran. 
Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they’re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London.
Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia and creator of the webcomic Raruurien. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her on Patreon and DeviantArt. 
Dia Ja was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She graduated at Los Angeles County High School for the Arts in 2014, and is currently attending ArtCenter College of Design for Illustration. Check out her tumblr.
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Witchblade. @bryan_valenza
Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here.
From Ireland, Colm Ó Dúill is a verification specialist at TransferWise's office in Tallinn, Estonia, where he has lived since 2007. He holds an M.Phil. in Applied Linguistics and a B.Comm with French, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Linguistics. He is married with two children, and has been dabbling in creating constructed languages since 2005; Nymeran is his first developed constructed language.
Kendrick See is a full time concept artist and illustrator from Malaysia. He is currently working in the video game industry, and his job scope ranges from creating various idea development pieces, to breakdowns and 3D paintovers. He helped bring Shoddai to life with a map! http://sourshade.deviantart.com/
Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! http://nondev.deviantart.com/
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. He helped bring together many of the technological designs found in Glow. http://wingsofwrath.deviantart.com/
Official Glow T-Shirt design by Anny Maulina. Printed on Next Level Shirts and available in S-XL.
Character Buttons. Illustrations also used in Postcards.
Buttons and Postcards
Tanvir Plushie. Approximately 5x8x3" inches.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our sixth Kickstarter project, and as always the biggest risk is timely delivery. Last year we had a lot of issues regarding our manufacturers, and the lesson we took at the end of it all was that we need to be better.

For 2018, we want to ship our projects in as timely a manner as possible. We've set a deadline for this project of April and think we can wrap everything up by then. The only new manufacturing needed for this Kickstarter are the print copies for #2 as well as some runic pendants. Everything else is in stock and ready to go.

We'll do our best to improve our logistics, but are also committed to top quality customer support. If you ever have an issue, please let us know and we'll do our best to fix it. You can ask our previous backers - we do our best to make sure they're 100% satisfied.

At the end of the day, Mythopoeia is just Vince and Ray. We both have full time jobs outside of comics, but we're passionate about what we do and are committed to grow. We hope that comes across in the work.

campaign.story:
We hear you! You want stretch goals and more cool stuff, and so do we! 
Here it comes: Help us reach the fabulous 50.000, and we’ll create a Bestiary for you. It will be a whole new section in the book, with in-depth descriptions and illustrations of the creatures and characters in the Fall of Gods universe. 
Yes, a new section. In the book. Print as well as digital. Available to all of you, as big thanks for your support and enthusiasm! Hurry up and upgrade your pledge, or tell a friend.
FALL OF GODS is a series of cinematic illustrated novels, set in a realm inspired by Norse mythology
1670 backers helped us launch FALL OF GODS here at kickstarter with a massive roar - So huge, that 20th Century Fox picked it up, now developing it into a feature film. 
Now the saga continues in The Nomad; volume two in the planned trilogy;
The Eldest have awakened from their age-old slumber and Midgard and Jotunheim are at the brink of war. When Vali learns of a legendary Jotun witch who can bring back his wife from the dead, he travels North, across a realm torn by fear and xenophobia. But he soon finds himself on a collision course with Rolf Krake, Midgard’s cunning and war-mongering high chieftain, who may hold the key to Vali’s dark past - and the truth about the demon who dwells inside him.   
      Fall of Gods - the Nomad is the exhilarating sequel to Fall of Gods - She Is Gone, combining the written novel with epic illustration. 
   PLAY

Our unique approach to the book medium, is combining the massive amount of illustration with the written novel on every spread of the book. It gives an immersive experience, rarely found in books - we call it a cinematic novel. 
Fall of Gods - the Nomad is 11.7 x 8.7", 144 pages. Fall of Gods logo on frontcover will be debossed.  
        You can add the following products to your pledge, at a discounted price. These will be delivered together with your copy of Fall of Gods, at no extra shipping cost. Please note that you can only order addons if you are a backer at level STANDARD or above.
To buy an addon, click the Manage My Pledge button and increase your pledge manually with the total cost (in US $) for the addons you want. Your total pledge also needs to cover the shipping. When this Kickstarter is over, we will send out a backer survey in which you can mark exactly which addons you want. 
Brimstone: The Demon Within is a contemporary coming-of-age tale set in a treacherous realm that exists beneath our world. It is the story of a gifted girl thrust into a wilderness of wonder and terror, where she is forced to face her deepest fears. We have teamed up with Hollywood screenwriter Will Simmons to create this epic dark fantasy universe. 
The book is 156 pages, hardcover, and was successfully funded on kickstarter. See the campaign HERE
Fall of gods - She is Gone was our first Cinematic Novel, and we have learned a lot since then. We are really grateful for all the feedback we have received from our backers. We listened to your great thoughts on the book and redesigned our book format, for our second project, Brimstone.
As soon as we saw it, we knew had found a better format to communicate our vision, and show the enhanced quality in story, illustration and layout.
We know it is not ideal to have the first volume in another format than the second, but we need to make this change to create a stunning product that can hold up in the future. At some point we hope to do the entire trilogy in this format.
You get more illustrations, more pages and a bigger format..
Here is a comparison of the two volumes: 
    Fall of Gods started as a passion project- a collaboration between Art Director and co-founder of MOOD Rasmus Berggreen and Hitman writer Michael Vogt - and you all helped us get the story out to the world. 
MOOD is an entertainment design agency, located in Copenhagen, Denmark. At MOOD we love designing universes and building worlds for the biggest brands. See more here: moodvisuals.com
Our world class team at MOOD is doing all the artwork, and it will be stunning. MOOD is also handling layout and print, to deliver a quality product to you. 
  We are so excited that 20th century Fox is developing Fall of Gods into an epic motion picture! Maze Runner director Wes Ball is attached to direct the movie and the script has been adapted by Stuart Beattie, writer of Pirates of the Caribbean, Collateral, 30 days of night and many more. 
  From the Hollywood Reporter
    The story is already written and the storyboard done for the entire book. We need your support to finish the Artwork and layout, printing of the book and shipping. We want to give you the coolest book possible and that comes with a cost. This is how we plan our budget: 
  We are really excited to have been invited to Kickstarter's DRIP.
Drip is a subscription platform, where creators can share their creative work and release ongoing content for the subscribers.
It is the perfect place for us to show all the work that goes into creating our universes, and to give exclusive content and updates for backers. You can check out our profile here:  MOOD DRIP
      When we launched Fall of Gods, the very talented composer François Jolin wrote a beautiful and haunting book score, to contribute to the Cinematic experience. Listen to the first track Hunt below or go to spotify for the full score.

We have also been partner on Rise of the Necromancers, a very cool board game launched on Kickstarter earlier this year. So at this stage we have quite some experience dealing with a production cycle and handling print and shipping.

Shipping is always a little challenging, but we are confident we will get the product out on time and with our quality trademark.

We will be shipping with a German Partner within EU, and with an American partner in the US and to the rest of the world. Please see shipping under the pledges.

Thank you again for your support!

campaign.story:
Learn Japanese To Survive! Kanji Combat is an educational game, designed to be the ideal introductory course to the Japanese language! It's the third game in a smash-hit series, following Hiragana Battle and Katakana War - but you don't need to have played those!
This new game teaches you a separate part of Japanese: the Kanji writing system.
Compatible with PC & Mac, Learn Japanese To Survive! Kanji Combat is a spectacular mixture of learning, action, adventure and intrigue! Everything you need to start learning Japanese is contained within the game!
Japanese is a language that can be very daunting to begin learning. It contains a unique alphabet of intricate symbols that can be very confusing to newcomers. How do you write these symbols? How do you even pronounce them?! If you're asking yourself these questions, don't worry - that's completely normal!
The best way to learn a new language is with a learning tool that's going to keep you interested, challenge you at the right pace, and most importantly, keep you coming back for more. Learn Japanese To Survive! Kanji Combat is your ticket to easy Japanese learning! 
Battle fierce Kanji monsters!
Want to grab some sweet rewards outside of your pledge level? Well, now you can! Add-ons are the ideal way to pick up specific rewards that you like, without having to pledge more than you want.
You can add an extra amount to your pledge to receive the following goodies. You can do this anytime after backing the project via the BackerKit survey we will send out when the campaign wraps up!
The Japanese language combines 3 different sets of characters to form written works: Hiragana, Katakana and Kanji.
This game focuses solely on Kanji, the biggest set of characters. Kanji are unique pictorial symbols borrowed from the Chinese language. Because each Kanji is so intricately designed, many students find them hard to learn. This game will teach you the correct way to write and pronounce Kanji, and your memorisation exercises will take the form of exciting gameplay!
This game features over 200 Kanji characters to learn and master. With this knowledge under your belt, you can begin reading and writing Japanese!
Learn useful Kanji in every lesson!
  At the start of each of the game's chapters, you'll learn a new set of Kanji characters. Following that, you're free to go on adventures and explore.  
You'll encounter dangerous enemies that have taken the shape of Kanji. To defeat them, you'll need to correctly translate them! If you give the wrong answer, your attack will be reflected and used against you. It's a learn & live situation!
Much like the other games in this series, you will also have the opportunity to learn some Japanese vocabulary! You'll see how words are constructed using Kanji, and learn the translations of useful words and phrases.
Put your knowledge to the test in battle!
      Learn over 200 Kanji characters, with detailed instructions on how to read and write each character.
Learn useful mnemonic techniques to recognise each Kanji.
Audio speech examples from native Japanese speakers demonstrate how to pronounce each Kanji character.
Follow along with the exciting story that will see you travel to Japan to defend the country from shape-shifting monsters!
Exciting gameplay with familiar RPG elements - collect items, complete quests, engage in batles!
Build a new town from the ground up. Customise your town with different features!
Form new friendships and get to know each of your companions with unlockable story sequences.
Earn experience points and level up your characters.
Review completed lessons to brush up on your knowledge.
In-game quizzes test what you're learning.
In addition to all of these features, the game will have an original soundtrack! We have partnered with some of the most talented composers on the planet to bring you a musical score worthy of praise. You can listen to some samples right here! 
[Courage In Your Heart] composed by Sam Luff. Performed by Sam Luff & Kelly Mahoney.

[The True Self Contains Unlimited Potential] and [Let Destiny Give Way To Your Ambitions] composed by Alec Shea. Performed by Alec Shea.
Upgrade your town and expand your learning opportunities!
      Ready to learn Japanese? You bet you are!
Learn Japanese To Survive! Kanji Combat is on track for release on PC and Mac in August, 2018. Back this project to receive updates and get some sweet rewards!
While you wait for the release date, why not check out the other games in this series? Available now on Steam, these games are solid introductions to the language and will make you even more prepared to play Kanji Combat.
Learn Japanese To Survive! Hiragana Battle [on Steam]
Learn Japanese To Survive! Katakana War [on Steam]
  For this game, we are including a lot of content that our previous games unlocked as stretch goals (such as voice acting, flash cards and more characters). Because of this, our initial Kickstarter goal is higher than previous projects. We want this game to be as complete as possible, without having to rely on hitting stretch goals.

As such, the stretch goals outlined here will not enhance the core game, but will help us improve the game's presentation and the overall experience.
$40,000: 「Audio drama!」
A collection of short stories featuring the characters and their endeavours to learn Japanese. Fully voice acted and provided in an audio file so you can listen on your computer, smart phone or music player! Audio dramas are popular accompaniments to manga and anime releases in Japan, so we'd love to produce one for this game!
$70,000: 「Fully animated sequence!」
A short anime-style sequence developed by a Japanese animation studio! This will feature the main characters in some new and exciting situations.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've learned a lot from our last two successful Kickstarter projects!

Hiragana Battle was praised by the gaming community, but there was definitely room for improvement. So, we enhanced Katakana War to please newcomers and hardcore gamers alike.

Both of our previous games managed to meet the promised release dates and rollout on Steam successfully. We've shipped thousands of physical rewards too, which proved very popular.

So, even though we've done this twice before, there will always be challenges. Kanji Combat is a very large game, and we will be drawing upon all our previous experience to bring it to life. We'll be counting on dozens of beta testers to punish the game and highlight anything that needs improvement.

We are actively seeking feedback from backers and fans. Tell us what you want to see in the game, and most importantly, tell us what works for you and what doesn't.

With your help, we can create an educational game that is a joy to play and a pleasure to learn with!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello classmates!
Very excited to announce today that the kanji flash cards have finally shipped out from the manufacturer! These are being delivered direct from the manufacturer to eligible backers, so you shouldn't have too long to wait until your parcel arrives.
We're terribly sorry that these didn't ship out before the game launched. Please accept our sincerest apologies for the delay.

It's finally here!
  The game you've all been waiting for... Learn Japanese To Survive! Kanji Combat has just launched on Steam!

We've managed to create something truly wonderful with this game, and it's all thanks to the incredible efforts of our amazing Kickstarter backers.

Hello classmates!
For our lucky backers that selected physical rewards: You will be getting your hands on them very shortly! The Kanji Combat game discs, study guides, art books and soundtracks have all been shipped out. Woohoo!
We're still working alongside our flash card manufacturer to get these shipped out ASAP. We should have them in the mail early next week.

Hello classmates!
We want to share some wonderful news today.
Learn Japanese To Survive! Kanji Combat will release on Steam on 1st August!
Thanks to our successful beta testing program, we've been putting the finishing touches on the game. Everything is just about ready to go, and the release date is booked in with Steam!
