campaign.story:
UPDATES
Sep 6th: UPDATE 6 - Second stretch goal REACHED!
Sep 1th: UPDATE 5 - First stretch goal reached!
Aug 25th: UPDATE 4 - NEW REWARDS!!!
Aug 20th: UPDATE 3 - Stretch goals revealed!
Aug 19th: UPDATE 2 - First goal reached, more to come!
Aug 10th: UPDATE 1 - Pledge Add-ons

Thanks to YOUR support, we have reached our base goal and have set up THREE NEW STRETCH GOALS!
 There are still many old-school filming techniques and practical effects we didn't use, primarily because nowadays, some of them are very rare, exotic and require special materials and tools. Techniques like matte paintings and rear projections would make „Slice of Life“ even more atmospheric and visually appealing, so it was always our wish to include them in our movie. If we reach this goal, that wish would become a reality! Plus, we would build even more more miniatures and that means a bigger, more vibrant cityscape!
 Our first stretch goal would enrich the visual appeal of the movie, and this one would add more drama and tension to its story. It is a scene that demands a brand new set, made from scratch, but it would be well worth it because that scene would give more gravitas to our main character and the struggle he has with himself, his nemesis and this damn city he's stuck in!

Even though „Slice of Life“ premiere will be held in Zagreb, Croatia, we always wanted to have another, international one. And what better place to do it than the center of film industry: Los Angeles. Not to mention that our movie is set in the streets and on the platforms of that same, albeit futuristic LA, so it would be kind of poetic! „Slice of Life“ on the big screen, in-depth and detailed film-makers show and tell and a chance to hang out with you guys (and a couple of cold ones)... yap, that would be a dream come through!
       When we started working on “Slice of Life”, we wanted to make an original movie set in a rather familiar world, and the biggest influence for us was clearly “Blade Runner”, as Ridley Scott, Jordan Cronenweth, and other movie legends envisioned it back in 1982.
Wet, foggy, and gritty streets of futuristic Los Angeles were a perfect place for our story, but we didn’t want to just copy/paste it and shoot a replica… We wanted to pay our tribute to “Blade Runner” in terms of aesthetics, and at the same time make “Slice of Life” something more than a mere fan-film or a sequel, with an unique storyline that doesn’t rely on anything seen in the “Blade Runner” universe.
That being said, “Slice of Life” is a tasteful homage to the masterpiece that inspired us on so many levels and we are honored if anyone can put our little movie in the same sentence as one of the greatest cinematic accomplishments of our time, but that is where the connections between these two movies end and our paths diverge. 
The duration of the short film will be approximately 20 minutes.
    Follow Slice Of Life on: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram
  It is just another damp, rainy, and foggy night on the streets of the futuristic Los Angeles. Beneath the flashy neon signs and heavy traffic, scum of this megalopolis tries to make a living and hopefully survive to see another day.
Criminals, junkies, prostitutes, punks… and one lonesome drug dealer in the middle of it all, fed up with this ever expanding city and lowlife parasites that inhabit it. He may be well on his way to leave it all behind, but fate has made other plans and his whole world will come crumbling down when a dirty cop with an agenda of his own enters his life.
  A big part of that 70s and 80s Sci-Fi allure comes from the use of practical special effects. Visionaries of that era relied on miniatures and models, animatronics, matte paintings, and other techniques for creation of those lavish imaginary worlds. Even today, 30 or 40 years later, the charm and depth of their work remains unparalleled. We are not against CGI and other modern era tools (we use it heavily in our commercial work), but in order to pay a worthy homage to our predecessors, we wanted to make “Slice of Life” as authentic as we could.
So, everything you see in our trailer and will see in the completed movie is made the “old-school” way.
We learned to build miniatures, light them properly, learned how to create practical effects, so that we could film everything in camera like people did back in the 80s. We filmed on real sets that we built from scratch for “Slice of Life”. All of the miniatures and real-sized sets were created from cheap materials, junk, computer parts, and lots of imagination.
Building the "car set":
Old Citroën BX 1986 bought for the production
    Finished car interior
 Building the miniature car for exterior scenes:
Miniature car model
    We have spent the last three years in a garage, taking every spare moment of our time and all of our skill, dedicating it to bringing “Slice of Life” to… well, life.
Our core team consists of only three people, and with some help of our friends and family, we carried this project on our backs for as long as we could, but we realized that, in order to finish our movie in the way we envisioned it, we need the help from our fans and the wider community. As a platform best suited for our needs, we chose Kickstarter to present this movie, connect us with our audience, and give you a chance to be an essential part in the creation of “Slice of Life”.
Filming the miniature city
  Filming the car interior
    We need you guys to help us finish the movie. A big part of the movie is shot, but we have an extensive miniature shoot ahead of us and a complicated post-production process.
For the miniature shoot we need better equipment like new lenses and additional lighting, and a professional motion control system (because everything will be shot in passes*).
*Shooting in passes - a complicated and slow process of shooting the same shot multiple times in different lighting conditions, the same way it was done in the 80's.
There’s also lots of additional miniature building which is very time consuming so we need to put our daily commercial work on hold.
Unpainted building made from junk / Finished miniature building
The cherry on top will be the soundtrack. Vangelis is infiltrated in our minds and souls, so we have a pretty big mountain to climb. Help us, and together we’ll put our “Slice of Life” flag on top of it!
  First and foremost, you get our deepest gratitude, not just for helping us financially, but for believing in us and our project. We want to thank you for your support and trust, and give you something to remember "Slice of Life" as one of your fondest memories in the years to come.
That being said, we prepared lots of cool “Slice of Life” props, T-shirts, special “Slice of Life” collectors’ boxes and a beautiful movie soundtrack, exclusively pressed on vinyl. Of course, there will be one more thing - this finished short film called “Slice of Life”, which you will be able to enjoy for a very long time in the years to come.
    Limited edition police badge, cast from the production molds
    This cute spaceship is looking for a new home!
  With less than 2 weeks to go, we’ve decided to stir things up a bit and offer you something really special: two new awesome and unique rewards!
It’s the one that our character drives throughout the whole movie and basically is a character of its own. This is not just a screen used model or fun looking prop that would look nice on your shelf, it is a true piece of craftsmanship, and a piece of our film’s history.
We’ll create a unique 15-second retro sci-fi commercial for your business, that will be featured in “Slice of Life” as one of the commercials projected on those huge building screens for 5 seconds. And now the best part, you’ll get full copyright for the 15-second commercial to use it in real life promotion for your company! Show the ad to the world on your web site, social media, YouTube, TV etc.!
 You like our reward tiers and want to contribute, but feel like you’re missing out on something? Don’t worry, we’ve got you covered! With this add-on system, you can build your own perfect reward package and enjoy full “Slice of Life” experience with all of the items you want. There are NO LIMITATIONS to the number of add-ons you can get: all you have to do is choose an amount to add to your pledge and answer a survey at the end of the campaign regarding the items you want. You can choose from the following list of items and follow the instructions bellow: 
*included in every Blu-ray/DVD Set of "Slice of Life"
 To add an add-on to your pledge, follow these steps:
1. Press the “Back this Project” button above. If you’ve already pledged, it will say “Manage Your Pledge”.
2. Choose a reward you are interested in and increase your pledge in the “Pledge Amount” box by the amount (in US dollars) of item or items you want to add. (There are no limitations to the number of items you can add.)
3. We’ll send you a survey after the end of the Kickstarter campaign regarding the add-ons you chose.
After we have launched our trailer, we had great luck to be picked up by many esteemed international publications like “The Verge”, “io9 Gizmodo”, “Huffington Post” and movie fan sites like “Jo Blo”.
We appreciate all the help that we have managed to get so far. But now, the time has come to make our biggest and final step: KICKSTARTER.
So if you are a member of the media and you would like to help a few hardcore movie lovers that are trying to make something special from their garage by covering our story or arranging an interview – please, contact us at relax@sliceoflifefilm.com
Any help with spreading the word around would be AWESOME. Please share our story with anyone you think might appreciate the project. It would mean the world to us. Also, you can share our campaign through the "Share" button at the top. Sharing is caring!
The Verge article : https://www.theverge.com/2017/1/29/14430964/blade-runner-croatian-filmmakers-fanfilm
io9 article: http://io9.gizmodo.com/this-blade-runner-fan-film-looks-absolutely-gorgeous-1791789192
 If you're hooked and can't wait to see the finished "Slice of Life" film in all it's glory with tons of bonus features don't fall into despair! As we said most of "Slice of life" was filmed over the span of 3 years. So here's your chance to watch the painfully beautiful journey of making the film in our garage. Witness how we managed to survive an ant invasion, film through the biggest croatian heat wave in the last 50 years and learn all about "spiderweb transplantation". Plus, listen to some cool blues while watching this fun and epic featurette series.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
“Slice of Life” is a massive project, and if we take in consideration all of the facts (small crew, heavy use of practical effects, insufficient time and funds to fully commit to it), we have done a pretty good job in the last three years.

Most of the principal shooting is completed, so the film will come out one way or another, but we don’t want it to be just another short sci-fi movie that you scour through and forget about 20 minutes after you had watched it. We want to make “Slice of Life” an unforgettable experience for fans of the genre and also for those who don’t really know that much about it, and to pay a truly worthy tribute to the classics that kept inspiring us for so many years.

We hope that we are not alone in this and that you share our love and admiration of those classics (and movies in general), and we welcome you to join us on our adventure.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Yo guys!
Well, it seems 2020 isn't turning out to be quite as we expected for all of us. Instead of enjoying the  summer in sexy speedos and banana hammocks, we have to deal with face masks, social distancing and other small "delights" this pandemic brought us.
Fortunately,  there is some good news! As you read this update, postal services across the world are  shipping first packages of "Slice of Life" rewards. Initial round are rewards containing only DVD/Blu-ray and/or T-Shirt perks, and depending  on what continent you are on and what COVID protocol your country has,  you should be getting your packages any day now.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 22 - THIS HOLIDAY SEASON, SLICE OF LIFE IS COMING TO YOUR HOME!
updates.update_content:
Ho ho ho!!!! Merry Christmas!!!!

Our dear friend Santa told us that this year all of you were exceptionally good, so we prepared a very special Christmas present. After all, your support kept us going and was one of the crucial things that made “Slice of Life” possible. You showed great patience and understanding while we brought this project to the finish line. So now, when the movie is completed, it’s time for you to finally see it!

Without further ado and with a faint drum roll in the background, we proudly present “”! All you have to do is check your e-mail inbox where you’ll find a secure link to the movie, and hopefully enjoy watching it as much as we did making it. As promised, this is a definite director’s cut version of the movie, and you’ll be the first ones to watch it the way we always intended it to be.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 21 - SLICE OF LIFE GO AMERICAS
updates.update_content:
YO GUYS!
Well, the summer is coming to an end, so it's time to fill you in with some new information about "Slice of Life".
First thing first, for all of you who are dying to see the movie and can't wait for your perks to arrive, we are still on the track. It won't be long till it's all done and ready to be shipped. The vinyl and the book are prepared and need only to be printed, and we are currently working on the documentaries, so our epic journey really is coming to its end. And again, thank you all for the patience and love you gave us!

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 20 - SLICE OF LIFE L.A. PREMIERE
updates.update_content:
YO! It's time for our big summer update!
We have some great news to share with you, but first thing first, we want to address all of the questions regarding the release of the movie and your perks. As you already know from our previous update, we are currently on the festival circuit with a shorter version of "Slice of Life", and we believe that this festival cycle will be over in the next couple of months. It's same with the perks, as we need to finish documentaries, books, posters, vinyl, boxes and everything else you pledged for.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 19 - SLICE OF LIFE IN TOKYO!

updates.update_content:
Yippee ki-yay!!!
How are you guys??? Chillin' during the Holidays??
Here's some info from the Slice of Life headquarters. As we said, sound and music mix on Slice of Life is almost finished. The big news for us is that very soon we'll head to Berlin, Germany to do a professional 'Color grading'. That's gonna give our movie that little extra something to make it just the way we envisioned it.

Howdy!
We're back today with a brand new Production diary!
The movie is edited, and for the past few months we've been working hard on sound design and the soundtrack.
We didn't record absolutely any sound during filming. It was too complicated because of the on and off filming we did, and we actually decided that since we don't have dialogue we don't even need to bother. The plan was to recreate all the sounds in the studio with the help of our friend Ivan Mihoci. And that's actually totally OK. Even if we recorded sound we would probably re-record and replace a lot of it to get specific sounds that we wanted.

YOOOO everybody!!

So we have been very busy. We finished filming all the miniature work and now we can show you the latest Production Diary.. what number are we up to? ahhh yes 14!! WOW!
YO!!!

Yo everybody!!!
That's right, we can safely say we finished the filming of ALL scenes with the actors. (For real this time, I know we had about seven wrap parties so far but nobody needs to know about that...)
The last scene we filmed was the mysterious NIGHTCLUB SCENE. I can't say anything about it except giving you a small teaser:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although our first Kickstarter was successful, it came with a few setbacks. We encountered the same perils that first-time Kickstarter’s fall victim to, and the underestimation of shipping costs was one of them. While this shortcoming was a struggle, we've learned to be one step ahead in the facets of production.


 For this Kickstarter, we’ve streamlined our rewards while also ensuring a more minimalist approach for faster production times.

 Please feel free to check out our previous funded Kickstarter for Amelia Sky issue #1 here: 
www.kickstarter.com/projects/2027539363/amelia-sky-comic-book-series

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel Girrion. This campaign is specifically for the funding the creation Issues 8 and 9, which will complete Volume1. That means MOST of the book is already complete. I only have about 50 pages to go out of the 225+ pages in the series.
New to the story? Not to worry!  All of Volume 1 is available in this campaign. Also Issues 8 and 9 will be of course available as well for those who have already been following along.
Thanks to the lovely and amazing Kickstarter community I've had Issues 2 - 7 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted, when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldy magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
        Inking in progress
        Volume 1 cover art in progress
     Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships and environments.
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. When I would draw environments or characters the ideas would just pop in my head. One scene led to another, then another etc. It took a lot of time, but the experience put in over the years not only helped the art, it also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
            This will be the first campaign where a full volume book is available. It will be 225+ pages in length. 6.14" x 9.2"
Volume 1 mockup. Cover art and design are in progress.
 Previous campaigns single issues were available in hardcover or softcover, and these formats will be available in this campaign as well. 
Sample Hardcover (Issue #7)
 Hardcover comic issues are 6" x 9". Grey cloth with a dust jacket. Each issue is anywhere from 22 - 26 pages in length.
Softcover samples (Issues 1-9)
Softcover comic issues are 6"x9" and have a glossy cover with a stock thicker than standard comics. The interior art is full color and has a watercolor feel.
Sample Character Sketch
  Sample 4" x 6" print
  How Do Add Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) Add the total of your Add On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
  Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.
  Scout Comics is now publishing Girrion! They released Issue 1 last October and will be releasing books up through this Fall. They are an indie publisher– very supportive of their creators and just a great group of people all around. They also have a wide range of comics which you can check out on their site. www.scoutcomics.com
Follow
Website: www.girrion.com
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Girrion1
Instagram: www.instagram.com/girrion1/
Facebook: www.facebook.com/girrion1/
Music from Kickstarter Video: "Night Owl" by Broke For Free
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience, the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job.

I've learned a lot from previous Kickstarter campaigns, and I am getting more and more efficient. I'm also trying to find ways to make rewards as cost-effective as possible too. One way of doing this is to do more than one issue per campaign, which cuts down on mailing costs. Before it took so long to complete just one issue and I could only offer one per campaign, but now I plan on doing 2 -3 issues per campaign from now on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
NEW ART ADDED:
      Hi! My name is Ross Tran and welcome to World of Nima! I’m a digital illustrator for the Entertainment Industry and I’ve been producing videos for my YouTube channel RossDraws for almost two years.
Nima is my original character whose story and world I've been developing for the last 4 years. Nima is a combination of all my childhood influences and inspirations and I want to inject every bit of life from the grand adventures I experienced as a kid into my own personal world.
Nima’s story takes place in a world with hauntingly beautiful and vibrant locations. I want Nima’s world to excite people the way I was drawn into the world of Avatar the Last Airbender. I draw a lot of inspiration from anime like Full Metal Alchemist, fighting games like Super Smash Bros., and movies like Spirited Away. Nima’s world will take you through an expansive and magical journey with a dynamic cast of companions, travelers, and enemies. This book will show my vision from start to finish, depicting this vivid world with scribbles, sketches, key scenes and cinematic paintings.
Every page will be crafted with care with a mixture of Typography, Layout, Graphic Design and Digital Illustrations.
  The book is the first step into introducing Nima to the world.

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel Girrion. This campaign is specifically for the funding the creation of Issue 7 (pages 182 -206 of Book 1).
New to the story? Not to worry! All issues will be available in this campaign.
Thanks to the lovely Kickstarter community I've had Issues 2 - 6 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
    GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted, when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldy magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
              Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships and environments.
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. When I would draw environments or characters the ideas would just pop in my head. One scene led to another, then another etc. It took a lot of time, but the experience put in over the years not only helped the art, it also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
              Hard cover sample
 Hardcover are 6" x 9". Grey cloth with a dust jacket.
Soft cover samples
Softcover books are 6"x9" and have a glossy cover with a stock thicker than standard comics. The interior art is full color and has a watercolor feel.
Sample Character Sketch
  How Do Add Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) Add the total of your Add On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
    Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.
Scout Comics is now publishing Girrion! They released Issue 1 in last October and will be releasing books up through this Fall. They are an indie publisher– very supportive of their creators and just a great group of people all around. They also have a wide range of comics which you can check out on their site.
Follow
Website: www.girrion.com
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Girrion1
Instagram: www.instagram.com/girrion1/
Facebook: www.facebook.com/girrion1/
Music from Kickstarter Video: "Night Owl" by Broke For Free

Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job.

campaign.story:
Dear friends! As you can see, our campaign has already ended. But you still have an opportunity to join the ranks of those selected backers who’ll get our watches before the retail selling starts, and with the special price too. Check our site www.divided-0.com and Indiegogo page.
Hello again, Kickstarter! Divided By Zero watches are back! After our first successful campaign we return to you to present the more superior and advanced βeta series. And more scientifically designed, of course :)
BETA SERIES: PASCAL / NEWTON / TURING / VOLTA
We're the small watchmaking company from Canada and also the creators of the first watches with mathematically approved design. Our previous αlpha series appeared on Kickstarter a year ago and attracted a small army of backers, raising 300% of initially requested funds. 
BETA SERIES: GALILEO / ARCHIMEDES
The main feature of Divided By Zero watches is its design concept. We prefer neat minimal design, monochrome palette and the highest quality with an affordable price. And we're totally crazy about accuracy and precision! That's why we used the miraculous power of science - all of our concepts are based on the researches, strict recommendations and direct involvement of actual mathematicians, architects and engineers, who helped us to create ultimate design with perfection in every detail.
We decided that our next project must explore the evolution of the design concept further. It blends accuracy of calculations with the beauty of natural science. The βeta series is inspired with the greatest minds of mankind and their inventions and the greatest minds of our team put a lot of effort to achieve absolution in every line, curve and index mark on the watch dial. Divided By Zero is the golden section of watch design!
This time we wanted to make every watch in the new series more individual and distinctive. Each watch has a strong connection between its design and concept, and for more character we added some prominent unique details to it. Meet the βeta series!
NEWTON
NEWTON
Newton explores the idea of the trinity concept which is the basis for an every object we create. And it's a very attractive shape, too ;) The main feature of Newton is the dial's reflective surface with a slightly changing tone of its color. It's named after Isaac Newton, referring to his teachings and laws of motion.
GALILEO
GALILEO
Galileo relies on pure minimalism in design. The concentric dial refers to orbits and the sub-dials are planet and its satellite. The most interesting feature is the partly sandwich dial which creates a multi-layer effect. This watch was named after the one of the greatest astronomers in history — Galileo Galilei.
ARCHIMEDES
ARCHIMEDES
Archimedes is the second one in our sub-dial department. It also has a sandwich volume dial and an ideally symmetrical face, supporting the whole idea of our mathematical design. Archimedes watch is the homage to the famous ancient Greek mathematician.
PASCAL
PASCAL
Pascal watch is the most complicated in the series! Yet simple to read the time, as always. It has a classic Nodus structure image on its dial. But the most notable thing is the handcrafted outer layer which is cut by the shape of the dial image! The watch's inspiration source is Blaise Pascal's researches. 
VOLTA
VOLTA
Volta is and ode to the geometrical beauty of the basic shape — circle, which is also a foundation in design for almost every watch. The model shares its name with the prominent Italian scientist Alessandro Volta.
TURING
TURING
Turing follows up the minimalist path in the βeta series. Its dial is decorated with an infinite loop to depict the idea of the abstraction of time itself. It bears the name of a swift minded genius of Alan Turing.
The second stretch goal is UNLOCKED!
The newest stretch goal is Copernicus watch. It's inspired by famous Medieval astronomer and mathematician Nicolaus Copernicus. Design of the model refers both to his personal astrolabe and to the theory of Copernican heliocentrism.
Copernicus is available in two different color options: black or white.
COPERNICUS
COPERNICUS BLACK
The first stretch goal is UNLOCKED!  

We are very proud with our concept we've brought to the first launch. That's why we decided to revise the αlpha series and present you the new enhanced versions of Gauss, Kepler, Plato and Euclid models. All αlpha watches come with the new thick strap with a spectacular red or blue edging and artificially weathered leather, domed crystal and reworked design, which slightly improves the initial developments preserving the main features. Suitable for those, who prefers more traditional outlook!
NEW ALPHA SERIES: GAUSS & KEPLER
NEW ALPHA SERIES: EUCLID & PLATO
Divided By Zero is a watch for everyone.
We may be over our heads with the obsession with maths and science, but our goal is to create watches you'd like to wear! That's why we try to make it perfect in every aspect.
We want Divided By Zero to become a part of everyone's wardrobe in the world! It's universality affords an easy strap change and suits every wrist with its massive yet sophisticated construction.
We give our watches the character to fit the individuality of its owner. You can easily find the specific watch that'll become a part of yourself.
The development of every model of Divided By Zero watches is a hardworking process. We study a lot of watches, try tons of designs and make infinite tests before we come up with a solid prototype.  
Thanks to our backers, we had a lot of feedback on our previous campaign. That's why we exactly know what we need to improve in our second series.
The DBZ team did their homework! First of all, there were some backers who wasn't very satisfied with our straps. The issue is solved! Now we offer the more superior high quality genuine leather straps, which are much thicker and more sturdy than before.
We wanted to add some distinctive features in our design, which would be unique and memorable and make our watches stand out. The new DBZ βeta series comes in a pitch black color palette with the signature blue square root second hand.
For the new series we've also replaced flat crystal with domed to make more “out of this world” impression and offer you a better view on our trademark design.
One of our experimental features is the hand cut bezel for the Archimedes model corresponding to the design pattern.
All of our straps have the blue edging — main color of Divided By Zero watches.
Galileo and Pascal have minimalist sub-dials placed on the different layers with the main dial. Both models have artificially aged case and strap buckles.
The other thing, rather than design, a lot of people love Divided By Zero watches for, is its affordable price. Our primary goal is to bring our projects to life and make happy as much people as we can with our watches. That's why we offer such an attractive price on the DBZ watches, which is only $95 USD! There are several factors that affect the price.
No retail margin at all! That’s right! You get your watches directly from the manufacturer, avoiding any middlemen with their commissions on the way to your wrists.
Production costs. We’re always transparent and honest about it. There’s a graph below showing how we could achieve such an affordable price with an every stage of manufacturing and every piece of the watch itself priced accordingly as well as company profit.
This graph depicts the difference in pricing policy between Divided By Zero and most of other watch brands in similar price range. Such an attractive price formed by avoiding any extra distribution costs and retail markups, as well as significantly cutting the brand’s profit.
The new βeta series watches are made of high grade 316L stainless steel with a black PVD coating with the total weight of 45 g for each timepiece! It comes with a thick genuine leather ZULU strap, domed crystal and offers 5 ATM water resistance. The movement is the accurate and reliable Japanese-made Miyota.
Case Diameter: 43 mm
Case Thickness: 9.5 mm
Face Diameter: 37 mm 
Total Weight: 45 gram
Band Material: Genuine Leather 
Band Width / Length / Thickness: 20 mm / 255 mm / 2.0 mm   
Case Material: 316L Stainless Steel 
Buckle: 316L Stainless Steel 
Crystal: Domed mineral
Movement: Miyota 2035 / Miyota 6P25 (Japan) 
Water Resistant: 5 ATM
Here’s the graph showing estimated production period – from the Kickstarter campaign to the shipping. We’re confident in terms and that each stage will be completed in time because of our experience with the previous campaign. Last time we delivered the watches to our backers in a month ahead of the schedule!
Social media are the perfect tool to influence the success of the campaign. If you like our concept and our watches, please, tell your friends about it. Together we can achieve much more to succeed and make Divided By Zero a strong brand with a faithful army of supporters!
FACEBOOK: facebook.com/divided0
TWITTER: twitter.com/divided0 
INSTAGRAM: instagram.com/divided0
You can get high the definition images of the DBZ watches on our Flickr page. Feel free to use the best we have, if you’re a journalist, a blogger or simply like our style :)
For any other press related issues contact us on: hello@divided-o.com

While preparing our first campaign a year ago, we established a reliable contact with the manufacturer and the quality control party to make the manufacturing process fast and smooth. We still work with them, so there's no need to worry about the watch quality and production issues. We also have the final prototypes of our current project so there will be no need in testing it.

We learned a lot about how to struggle with difficulties previous time and even managed to deliver our watches in a month ahead of the schedule. That's why we're sure that even if there will be any obstacles in our way, we could easily overcome any of them!

updates.update_userinfo: The new collection by DBZ watches is live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Dear DBZ family.

Just in case you missed it, we want to let you know that the third series of our scientifically designed watches are live on Kickstarter and are funded already, within the first 9 hours! The new series is inspired with the space researchers and their studies and introducing a couple of new features such as the reworked slim case with flexible lugs and hollow points to make it weight lighter, the date window and Swiss Super-Luminova® luminous pigmentation that not only creates bright colorful afterglow, but also is a part of the design itself!

updates.update_userinfo: The new Gamma series by DBZ is launching tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
Dear DBZ family!

The most important moment of the year for DBZ is closer than ever.
Tomorrow (10/31) we're launching our freshly new Gamma Series on Kickstarter!!!
This collection offers totally new design, both in construction and appearance and is inspired by science, space and astrophysical researches. There are a lot of new interesting features, with the Super-LumiNova™ luminous filling as the main design element. The lume not only creates a mild pleasant glow, but continues the design as well! Wanna learn more?

updates.update_userinfo: The last model of the Gamma series revealed!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!

Here's another concept from our upcoming series. The watch design is inspired by a hypothetical phenomena of wormholes in time and space, creating a minimal look with a hypnotizing pattern. 

What do you think about this one? Will you be interested in seeing it on your wrist?

updates.update_userinfo: New photos of the upcoming series. The launch is coming close!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!

Here's another concept for the upcoming series. This watch is inspired by the beautiful celestial body we can see every day (or night, to be more specific). The dial design of this model refers to the moon phase, in its crescent form, and its satellite nature. The dial has its own orbits with a date window as its tiny satellite. What do you think of this one?

updates.update_userinfo: Another glimpse on the Gamma series
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!

Here's the second concept for you to judge :) This one is inspired by the planetary movement and our own Solar system's structure, the minimalist way, of course.

What do you think about this one, friends?

updates.update_userinfo: New info and photos of the upcoming Gamma series!
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!

We want you to know that we're currently working on the new series for DBZ. It's called Gamma. And for a reason, not just an alphabetical order ;) All models in the Gamma series are going to have a unique luminous glow which serves as a part of design, combining daytime and nighttime perspective as a whole image. This series is inspired by space discoveries and scientists who put a lot of effort in researching our Universe. The Gamma series will receive more futuristic design not only in a dial department, but also in a brand new case!

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Tom Lintern and this campaign is for my graphic novel Girrion. This campaign is specifically for the funding the creation of Issue 6 (pages 128 -156 of the Book 1).  
New to the story? Not to worry! All issues will be available in this campaign.
Thanks to the lovely Kickstarter community I've had Issues 2 - 5 funded on previous campaigns. This project began years ago and has slowly turned into something I am really devoted to and would love to work on for years to come.
  GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted, when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldy magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
Samples from Issue 1:
     Samples from Issues 2, 3, 4 & 5:
   Page in progress from Issue 6
     Girrion started off as a hobby over 15 years ago. Initially it was more of an illustration portfolio than a story. I wanted to be a concept artist, so I would spend a lot of time designing characters, ships and environments. 
Much of my inspiration still came from things like Star Wars, Robotech and Appleseed and I wanted to do something where I was creating a new world. Something that felt original. 
I didn't consider myself a writer back then, but I started getting ideas for a story. One scene led to another, then another etc. Five yeas passed, then 10 and I had the story but I didn't have the professional illustration chops STILL, and the comic just didn't look how I wanted it to. Luckily all the time I put in over the years not helped the art, but also gave me time to develop the story more and give it more depth than it had in the earlier drafts.
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
                 Softcover books are 6"x9" and have a glossy cover with a stock thicker than standard comics. The interior art is full color and has a watercolor feel.
Hardcover are also 6" x 9". Grey cloth with a dust jacket.
In days where sci-fi movies and video games often get so caught up in special effects, crazy camera edits (all the glitz basically), I feel like something has been lost. All these distractions often take me out of the story rather than make me more interested. 
When it comes to fantasy and science fiction I want two things: immersion and creativity. That's what I'm trying to do with Girrion- to simply make a new type of story in an imaginary world that feels real. Instead of creating dozens of worlds that we get to go to one-by-one, I'm focusing heavily on one.
I'm also a fan of the hero's journey, which is an influence, but I feel like the same story is getting told over and over again. Girrion's storyline has a rhythm to it, but I've done my best to make it unpredictable. Instead of an underdog versus and overwhelming powerful antangonist, it's about different races trying to get their foothold in a situation where everyone is vulnerable. So far this approach has lead to some interesting options for me as a writer, and I feel it is hard for the reader to guess what will happen next.
How Do Add Ons Work?
Here's what you do:
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button)
 Add the total of your Add On to your pledge amount. (i.e. one Giclee Fine art print is $25.) You don't need to change the tier you've selected 
You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. Thank you!
  Generally, about half of my expenses come from printing the books and mailing them. The other half of the budget is going into the production. Most of what this campaign money goes towards is large chunks of time for me to focus fully on the book. One issue takes me 300 - 400 hours. If I'm able to knock off some days working freelance on other jobs, the books come out much faster.
    Well, since last campaign there's been some major news:
Scout Comics is now publishing Girrion! They released Issue 1 in October and most recently Issue 3 hit comic book stores just the other day. They are an indie publisher– very supportive of their creators and just a great group of people all around. They also have a wide range of comics which you can check out on their site.
Reading with a Flight Ring: Girrion #1
A Place to Hang Your Cape: REVIEW: GIRRION: Book 1: The Chrysalis & The Stone #1-3
Website: www.girrion.com
Twitter: www.twitter.com/Girrion1
Instagram: www.instagram.com/girrion1/
Facebook: www.facebook.com/girrion1/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Story:
Carnasus, the capital of the southern kingdom, lies in wait of its destruction. They know they cannot defeat the northern army that marches to destroy them, so if they do not find some way to prevent this attack from happening, these will be the final days of their long and bitter war.
-
-
In secret, and against the wishes of the city’s Regent, a disgraced knight has been tasked to lead a group of companions to assassinate the king of their advancing rival.
-
-
Meanwhile, far away to the north at the camp of Carnasus’ enemy, Prince Demetrius prepares the army for the arrival of his father - and begins a countdown to his own end, as well.
-
 “The best independently published graphic novel I have ever read.
This is a future classic.”  
         - Scott Mack, Writer for Indiecomix and co-founder of Ashcan
_
"The snow was red and sloshed beneath our feet.
We could dig no graves. We could lay no one to rest. They stared at us, the blame and anguish frozen on their faces – bodies, broken and jagged.
I pray the cold will free their souls.  
I pray I will forget."
_
Grinidon’s Development:  
Before beginning Volume 1, I spent more than twenty-years developing the story and characters of Grinidon.  I wanted to create a world with depth and history to make the experience as rich and authentic as possible.  Each character and faction has their own story and motivation, and as you read the series, you continuously discover new and interesting things to explore.   
-
    -
"Brilliant and beautiful…pulls you in from the first few pages."  
        - Cayti Elle Bourquin, author of Paradox Girl
-
_
Us:
Learning the ins-and-outs of creating a graphic novel is an epic saga of its own. Fortunately, Grinidon’s artist, Erwin Arroza (ASHCO Awards 2016 Nominee for Artist of the Year), is as talented and knowledgeable as he is dedicated and hardworking. He takes the same level of pride in his work as I do, and is just as committed to seeing the project grow. 
-  
"Arroza crushes expressive face-work like nowhere else in indie comics." 
         - Nick Macari, author of the Working Writer's Guide to Comics and Storycraft for Comics
-
“I cannot wait for more!”  
      - Jason R. Jones, author of The Last Pantheon
-
 "On-and-on they came, until there was no memory of who we were, only of what stood before us. 
I prayed for the dawn, but when it came, there was no relief in sight. 
As I watched everyone I loved and cared for fall around me, I could no longer dare to hope. I could imagine no other thing but my own end."

From a recent interview at Moby's:
The second Volume of J. Miles Dunn’s epic Grinidon is now funding on Kickstarter and I was able to ask a few more questions about the series.
The first volume, now available in print and digital, was successfully funded about a year ago. 

It’s hard to explain just how satisfying of an experience this Kickstarter has been. The physical book is great, full of all that wonderful art by Erwin Arroza (interviewed here). Seeing the samples and random pages was one thing, but being able to sit and enjoy it all at once was…well, wonderful.
   Of course, all is a relative term. The story is epic and in Volume One we have still only encountered two of the three Kingdoms vying for control of Calloway. There is so much more to be told…  
Thanks again to J. Miles Dunn for taking the time for this interview. New readers should also check out Moby’s first interview with J. Miles Dunn for even more background regarding Grinidon and the history behind the project and it’s artist.
-
Moby’s – Volume 1 of Grinidon, your labor of love, is finally out there and it’s beautiful. Tell us a little about the experience of seeing your project become a reality.
J. Miles Dunn – It’s just so unbelievable. The amount of thought and labor I put into this is not just beyond anything I’ve ever done, it’s beyond anything I ever thought I could do.   
My “to do” list just seemed to grow exponentially, and beyond the writing, technical, and logistical challenges, I actually had to start the book over three times. There’s just no preparing for something like that – but honestly, I don’t think it could have happened any other way.  
The whole thing is just such an incredible whirlwind of research, rewrites, luck, edits, and patience, that unless a person is wholly dedicated to their project and it comes from a place of real passion, I don’t see how anyone could see it through to the end.  
I hope that doesn’t dissuade anyone though, because after it’s finished, there’s no greater feeling than seeing your dream come to life. When you put that much work into something and it’s suddenly there before you, I also think that’s when you really know if this was something you had to do, or were meant to do.
-
In Vol. 1, we’ve only met two of the three Kingdoms of Calaway, and we’re left wondering if that mention of elves is foreshadowing anything. Can you tell us what new characters or races we might meet in Vol.2?
One of my favorite aspects of the story, after having worked on it for more than two decades, is its level of depth. I try to never throw too much at the reader, but a living and breathing world will always have new things to explore and discover.  
I will say that in Volume 2 you get to meet the last of the three kingdoms, which includes several new characters, but this journey of discovery is really only just beginning. You’re definitely in for some surprises!
-
I liked how at the start of the story it was about the war, but then that moved to the background as the characters and their mission moved to the front. And then the subplots… and it’s all great! Can I get some of your thoughts on this and where things are headed?
To me, the mysteries are always the greatest thrill. What would Star Wars be without the Force and each character’s own backstory and motivations? The same is true of the relationship between the between the characters, races and kingdoms of the Lord of the Rings. Every new encounter holds new answers, but also adds an infinite number of questions.   
If a story is done right, I think it is all very organic because everything is part of a whole. Fleshed-out stories and characters will always complement one another because each piece is part of a greater puzzle – and each section of that puzzle will come together in ways that may be unexpected.  
At this point, the reader doesn’t truly know what the puzzle even is.
-
Though the enemy of our heroes, Prince Demetrius is such a tragic figure. We only meet him at the end of Vol. 1, but he seemed to perhaps have the most potential of any of the characters in the story. Am I far off?
I like Demetrius because he immediately shatters the reader’s perception of “who” the group’s enemy really is – or at least that was my hope.  
In literature and in history, I often find that the internal struggles are far more interesting than the external ones – and you can’t fully appreciate one without the other. I guess it goes back to what I was saying before that each kingdom and character has their own story. There is a reason that people fight – even if that reason is a petty one.
Throughout each of the three kingdoms there are rifts and secrets. Demetrius is the first example of this within the North, but he definitely won’t be the last. You’re definitely not wrong to ask or speculate about his potential, and I’m genuinely excited to see your reaction to where things are headed, and who you question next.
-
Artist Erwin Arroza has already begun working on the art for Vol. 2, how is that coming along?  
Honestly, it is going even better than Volume 1. We couldn’t be happier with how things are moving.  
He is currently about fifty-pages into the second volume, but since I have so much of the story outlined, I am somewhat free to jump-around and tackle different sections of the issue where inspiration leads me. It is being illustrated in order, but I can’t say for sure how long the volume will actually be at this point. The first was 156 pages, so I guess we’ll have to see where this one ends-up.  
I really like that freedom in doing this as graphic novels and not smaller issues. It gives me greater flexibility to tell the story as it naturally unfolds. Having to compact things can be incredibly restrictive in terms of letting emotions, action, and dialogue play-out naturally. It definitely gives me a newfound sense of respect for comic book creators.
-
How many Volumes might there be in the Grinidon saga?
That is a somewhat difficult question to answer, but not altogether impossible.  
Originally I wrote them as novels but was fortunate enough to be able to make the transition into graphic novels – and by fortunate, I mean through luck and stubborn determination.  
The first novel, as I have it outlined currently, should come in at seven volumes. There are twelve books in the series if I take it to completion, but some are longer and shorter than others. I don’t think sixty would be too far from accurate – which means that if I’m lucky, I have a very long road ahead of me.
-

campaign.story:
Daedalus – is a thriller hard sci-fi adventure video game. You play an astronaut aboard the Daedalus Space Station, a man plagued by prophetic nightmares of death and destruction. You tell yourself they are only dreams, but after the first crewmate dies… what will you tell yourself then?
(click to move on the Daedalus Patreon page)
The game takes place in the hard sci-fi After Reset™ universe. In the 22nd century, several years before the "Reset" (a thermonuclear apocalypse that nearly ended human civilization), the crew aboard the Daedalus Space Station is eager to return home from a yearlong orbital exploration of Venus and Sun. Only thirty days remain until the next crew rotation, but Matt Cramer, an astronaut from the crew, begins to has unnatural dreams full of horrors that are about to become a reality.
Yet as the days count down to zero, strange events begin to unfold. Crewmates succumb to accidents or rumors of murder, communications go dark, and everyone grows increasingly on edge as conspiracy theories abound. Though help is on its way, you must survive long enough for it to arrive.
Throughout the game you will interact with six characters aboard the Daedalus Space Station, and below you’ll find an in-depth look at each of them with our character bios and HD art.
Hiroto Yoshida: JAXA, mission commander.
Matt Cramer: NASA, mission specialist (engineering science).
Jill Scott: NASA, mission specialist (biological science).
Eitan Levy: ISA, mission specialist (physical science).
Lia Medvedeva: Roskosmos, mission payload specialist.
Ron Armentos: AES, mission pilot.
  The Daedalus game will emphasize story, character development, and relationships over puzzle solving. The story is affected by the player’s dialogue choices and actions during timed events that can often lead to some of the station’s components being lost or damaged. It’s also possible to uncover new research or knowledge of various threats under investigation, to affect the outcomes of certain characters being killed, as well as the player’s relationship with the crew and the way they perceive each other. The choices made by the player will carry over from episode to episode.
The visual style for the game will be like a graphic adventure similar to The Walking Dead Game and Heavy Rain, with painted 3d characters and environments, and a third-person perspective gameplay POV with a variety of cinematic camera angles.
Concept Gameplay: Main Menu
Concept Gameplay: Loading
Concept Gameplay: Dialogs
Daedalus OST - Main Theme:
  • HARSH EMOTIONAL STORY: Each crewmember of the space station has the unique personality, background, story, desires and fears, friends and enemies on Earth. As one of them, you’ve worked with those people shoulder to shoulder for the last year between the blazing Sun and melting Venus, surrounded by the emptiness of space. With only thirty days left before you head home to Earth, something dark and older than the paleocortex takes your friends one after another. Something more dreadful than death itself, something that now leaks through your nightmares and envelops your reality by devouring everyone and everything that might escape from the station.
• REALISTIC HARD SCI-FI ENVIRONMENT: Developed with scientific realism, the Daedalus Space Station represents the latest technologies of the XXII century, the Golden Age of united humanity in the After Reset setting. The environment, equipment, and lore of the game represent the traditions of hard science fiction and an emphasis on scientific accuracy or technical details. Details about the Sun, Venus, spacecraft, and living conditions aboard the space station have been worked out in consult with scientists and NASA's Reddit forum so we can bring you a plausible and realistic version of the future that awaits humanity.
GENRE: Interactive Movie, Graphic Adventure.
TARGET PLATFORM: PC (Windows, Linux), Mac OS X. GAME MODE: single-player.
Atmospherically, it is inspired by: Solaris (by Stanislaw Lem), The Invincible (by Stanislaw Lem), Echopraxia (by Peter Watts), 2001: A Space Odyssey (by Stanley Kubrick and Arthur Clarke), The Ego Tunnel (by Thomas Metzinger).
At Black Clouds Studios we strive for transparency throughout the development process, and that includes financial data. Below you will find our planned budget for the development of the first chapter of the Daedalus video game. We’ll need roughly $168,879 to do everything we’d like to do, but our initial goal of $55,492 will still allow us to achieve a high quality experience that we think you’ll enjoy. While we’re hoping to meet our stretch goals, our experienced team can handle either funding strategy.
BUDGET (for the first episode):
Writing [2ppl]: $5,000
Painting (~400 arts*$100 + GUI) [4ppl]: $45,000
Programming [2ppl]: $8,000
Audio (music, vfx) [1ppl]: $5,000
Voiceover [6ppl]: $6,000
Video (cinematic) [2ppl]: $4,000
3D Modelling (6 chars, 16 environments) [studio] = $33,000
Engine Upgrade: $750
Project Management (10months) [1ppl] = $10,000
• Rough Summary: $116,750
Force Majeure (20%): $23,350
Kickstarter Project Costs: $9,350
• Pre-final Summary: $149,450
KS/Payments/Bank Fees (13%): $19,429
• TOTAL (before taxes) = $168,879
If the full costs are estimated at $168,879, WHY are we asking for only $55,492?
We’ll need $55k to accomplish our minimum goals and launch this production, but there’s a lot more we’d like to do that will make the game more immersive and enjoyable. We’re also including a financial buffer to pay for unexpected developments and setbacks.
Though it quite common for Kickstarter campaigns to leverage an initial fund with the hope of future investors, if we are unable to reach our final budget goal with stretch goals then our producer will pay the difference out of pocket. Rest assured that we will not release a buggy and incomplete product if we fall short. Please bear in mind that this budget is for the first episode or chapter of our game, and not the complete title, but your purchase includes all future episodes in this series.
Why EXACTLY $55,492?
Most of you have probably heard about the infamous “Potato Salad” project, a Kickstarter campaign that successfully collected a whopping $55,492 from 6,911 backers just to watch some guy make and eat potato salad. Granted there were t-shirts and social media advertising at play, but ever since that campaign we’ve used that figure as our criteria for our products. If we can’t raise at least that much for a game, then we must be doing something wrong.
Likewise, if a project takes off and achieves numerous stretch goals, it’s an excellent proof of concept for luring investors and building a franchise. Essentially, this is a tipping point for many developers.
From the budget we derive our estimated development timeline. Delays are always possible and should be expected, but keep in mind that every month of delay only increases our expenses — we don’t like it either! Still, we believe in delivering a functional and fun product over meeting an arbitrary deadline.
TIMELINE (for the first episode):
2016
• November – KS campaign completion; all team members meeting; modelling.
• December/January – scenario workout; team members coaching; modelling.
2017
• February – animatic and staging; engine modification; GUI/mechanics approving.
• March/April/May – painting; gameplay programming.
• June/July/August – VFX; voiceover; music.
• September – release.
TOTAL: 10 months.
Each further episode would take roughly 4 months.
Using Telltale’s The Walking Dead video game as a base model for our project, each episode should provide at least 120 minutes of gameplay and 400 scene-arts (roughly 3-5 minutes of gameplay each).
STRETCH GOALS:
As the Daedalus video game takes place in our vast, hard sci-fi After Reset setting, we would like to keep the atmosphere by giving each goals the names of the lore concepts which are considered in the game.
1. “Potato Salad” [$55,492 goal] – this is the basic goal to be reached, an indicator that our backers want to see this project come to life, a sufficient sum for us to proceed with quality development and guarantee the initial episode.
2. “Rydberg Matter” [$131,927 goal] – this is our estimated final budget that we need to achieve to do everything we want to do and not have to pay for it out of pocket.
3. “William Molyneux's Problem” [$168,879 goal] – at this point we feel prepared for anything, except perhaps the apocalypse itself. Our budget is solid and flexible, but there’s a lot more we could do if we had the time and money.
4. “Methanococcus Maripaludis” [$ХХХ,ХХХ goal] – for now this goal is a secret, but we look forward to sharing it with you!
5. “Solipsism Syndrome” [$ХХХ,ХХХ goal] – Top Secret :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
“The best predictor of future behavior - previous behavior.” (c)

Based on our previous experience (posted here and here), you can count on our team to deliver a product. Though it is very common for projects to be delayed, our producer (Richard) will ultimately be personally responsible for the project and the development of the After Reset franchise. He pledges to cover any missed funding goals out of pocket to ensure the successful delivery of the product, just as he has done with The Fall of Gyes and After Reset RPG. 

Delays, and the expense they incur, are the only significant risk to our project. Our team is experienced, our goals are reasonable, and we feel very confident about this production. 

Also, there will be no Steam Early Access for the Daedalus game, but we will share our progress with you and our alpha build on Kickstarter, in closed update (with NDA), as soon possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Have you ever been confused by irrational or emotional behavior of the crew of the space stations and spaceships in si-fi movies/games/books? Have your ever considered that real astronauts should behave and act another way?

updates.update_userinfo: Hard Sci-Fi: Murder Aboard Space Station
updates.update_content:
Hey guys,
Today I've finally payed off final bill for the trailer animation you might enjoy on the front page of the project. Hence, all early concept arts we've developed for it becomes our property as well as they become part of the After Reset universe themselves. I feel like to share them with you in full HD with some concise marginalia.

Hi guys,
Keeping the hard sci-fi approach to the story, gameplay and environment of the Daedalus, today I'd like to highlight the issue of space radiation: how it works for the long time space mission in reality and how the Daedalus' crew copes with it aboard the DSS.
Conventionally, my study of the issue in hand began on relevant NASA's Reddit several months ago...

Hi guys,
In this concise update I'd like to share our gameplay arts in full HD (1920x1080).
They are just drafts but still looks beautiful, I believe.
Daedalus: Main Menu (click to load full HD)

Hi guys,
This weekend update will take you aboard the International Space Station nowadays. The station, as well as its design, space engineering technologies, the knowledge we (I imply, humanity) have collected from our studies aboard – all that is intended to provide a robust scientific basement to the Daedalus, it’s storytelling, environment and atmosphere.
There will be a decent amount of links on thrilling and learning videos in this modest update. Albeit, I am sure, you’ll get closer to the reality of space/stars/planets after watching them :)

updates.update_userinfo: Hard Sci-Fi: International Space Station Nowadays
updates.update_content:
Hi guys,
In this update, we are keeping study the science behind the Daedalus, the explicit part that makes the whole After Reset universe so special. In one of the previous updates we already took a look at our “Way to Venus” and the “Daedalus Space Station (DSS)”.
And now I’d like to invite you to the topic of micro-gravity, artificial gravity the terms of spacecraft and c-Rings of the DSS. Once again, my studies began on NASA’s Reddit several month ago...

Hi guys,
I planned to head forward with sharing further hard-sci features of the Daedalus this Tuesday: “Micro-gravity Issues in Space”, “Science of Artificial Gravity for Daedalus”, “Radiation Issues”, etc. but past weekend connected me with two wonderful people from Kickstarter. Each of them not only a good person themselves but might help/contribute to the development of the Daedalus and the whole AR setting. First of them is Robert Simyar (our colleague, dedicated indie dev) I’d like to you to meet through this update. Please, let me give a brief presentation of them while we take a breath...
Meet Robert

Hi guys,
I’ve decided to make a swift separate update for friendly author on Kickstarter, Nick Delgado, and his short video project on KS – WEBCAM. The WEBCAM is a 10-minute short film with an exciting new take on the post-apocalypse genre that will show that even after the world crumbles, there will still be hope.

Metal Made Flesh is a cyberpunk space opera that has been likened to "Bladerunner meets Game of Thrones." 
Chased to the brink of extinction, Humanity is forced to take refuge in Tuaoni, a sprawling city on the black market trading hub Equan Yas. Reduced to extreme poverty, and treated as second class citizens by the planet’s inhabitants, humans must fight to survive.    
The series centres on three main characters, the cold, merciless cyborg Izobel Vice who loses more of her humanity with each passing upgrade; the psychopathic assassin Phaeon Nex, and Kalibos, a hideous mutant war machine.  Book One was released in 2014, and Book two's first edition was successfully Kickstarted in 2015.
Vengeance is the third in the series, centering on Phaeon Nex's quest for revenge. It's also the first story where all three main characters are in the same storyline. 

Vengeance features artwork and two stories from series creator Simeon Aston, and series regular Phil Buckenham. It also features one story from fellow Heavy Metal artist Vittorio Astone.  If we hit the stretch goals we'll also have work from Josan Gonzalez (The future) and Hector Trunnec (Midnight Persons).
Dependant on stretch goals, Vengeance will feature between 4-6 stories from writers such as 2000AD's TC Eglinton (Judge Dredd, Outlier), Peter Cooper (Telikos Protocol, Drone) and Cy Dethan (Starship Troopers). Main series writer Jeremy Biggs will also be returning for 3 stories.

campaign.story:
The Chasing Arrows Issue #0 will be a double-sized 40 page full color comic printed locally on recycled paper and wrapped & shipped in plant-based adhesive tape and recycled packaging. This Kickstarter is to help print Issue #0!
The Chasing Arrows Issue #1 is also available on this Kickstarter campaign! Issue #1 is also 40 full color pages! They will be signed copies of the first printing (1000).
Here's an idea of what's included in Issue #0...
Prelude: Flotsam and Jetsam
Prologue
3x Interludes with strange new characters
Ephemera
Here's an idea of what's to come in The Chasing Arrows series...
Issue #2 will be Onas's pilot issue (also 40 pages)
Issue #3 will focus on both Onas and Inara and we will see a lot more character interaction on the atoll.
More on the magic system
Eco-friendly shirts!
      To give you a quick idea of what The Chasing Arrows is think Waterworld meets Wall-E meets a Brandon Sanderson novel.
The Chasing Arrows story explores a future where earth has flooded and floating garbage patches, known as middens, cover the seas. The story will follow two main characters, Inara and Onas.
Both Inara and Onas are Chasing Arrows, people who scavenge the middens and lead lives of thrift. To be a Chasing Arrow is to follow the Old Codes and The Way of the Arrow. To be a Chasing Arrow is to find use for the useless, to readdress the value of things, and to indeed find trash to be treasure.
Inara and Onas are orphans who live on Kaisei Atoll, a floating island of scrap located in the Trash Belt Doldrums. Onas spends his days diving for scrap on the middens while Inara works as an engineer in the Underbelly of the atoll.
  "...feel like the abyss is calling me."
  "...can't stand crocheting plarn."
  "...they say he's lost his marbles, but really he's got millions."
  "...fork and bubble wand divination."
  "...the secret component."
I started writing The Chasing Arrows in prose. As I was writing it I realized I was spending huge amounts of time world building and writing long winded descriptions (two things that can get a novel writer in trouble). I wanted the story to have really cool magic system too. What I came up with was a system based on color. With all this in mind I realized a graphic novel would work great for this story and give me an excuse to do all the really fun novelty things behind making a story world (writing these long descriptions now as a script for my illustrator, making maps, drawing character sheets, seeing my characters come to life on the page, actually seeing the color of the magic system, and just in general being able to address the novelty book aspect with the story).
We're on the 'second' issue now and I'm so excited to keep them coming for you guys and gals. Your support makes this story happen!
I also think the health of our planet is important! As should we all! My characters fight for this, as I do, and as all the real Chasing Arrows of this world do!
The Chasing Arrows is a long-form, character driven story. The first story arc will most likely be 8 issues.
The Trash Belt: Made up of floating islands of trash known as middens. The middens circle the Tear in never ending drift. The Trash Belt is modeled after real life trash gyres.
The Tear: Asteroid-like landmass jutting from the sea. The Tear flooded the world long ago (this time was known as The Weeping). The Tear is about twice the size of Mount Everest to give an idea of scale. The Tear is at the center of the Inner Circle. The Inner Circle is the densest area of the Trash Belt. Earthquake-like atmosphere (midden-mass constantly shifting). Electrical storms. Serpents. Untraveled by humans.
The Himalayan Islands: Some of the last remaining area of dry land. Also known as the Mainland or Roof of the World. The Crescent Empire and rich noble houses reside here.
Kaisei Atoll: Floating island made up of scrap and old boats from the Time Before. Located in the Trash Belt Doldrums. Inara and Onas live here. The Underbelly is the underwater area of the atoll.
The Kelp Islands: Islands consisting entirely of mutated kelp. Ever shifting tides here. Rumored to be slave islands controlled by the Crescent Empire.
The Coral City: Mutated Great Barrier Reef. Now jutting five hundred feet above sea surface. Inhabited by humans?

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second Kickstarter! Woohoo! The last one went really well and I sent backers their rewards two months after the end date. I think that's pretty good. I've spent a good amount of time learning how to run a successful campaign and have really come to love it. Having creative control is awesome on so many levels, but it also means I have to do pretty much everything. Learning how to be good at all of it is definitely interesting and time consuming. 

This project is very important to me and I am really excited about it! I believe art can change the world, because surely so many forms of it already have in so many ways. I can't wait to share this story with all of you! I'll keep pumping out issues!

This story is dedicated to the real Chasing Arrows of this world!

Thank you so much for your support!
