campaign.story:
What is this project?
Learn Japanese To Survive! Katakana War is an educational game that is the ideal introductory course to the Japanese language! It's the sequel to the smash-hit Hiragana Battle – but you don't need to have played that!
This new game teaches you a separate part of Japanese: the Katakana writing system.
Compatible with PC & Mac, Learn Japanese To Survive! Katakana War launches you into a journey full of learning, action, adventure and intrigue. All you need to start learning Japanese is contained within the game!
STRETCH GOAL UPDATE:
$7,500: Partial voice acting! [UNLOCKED!]
$10,000: Two new playable characters! [UNLOCKED!]
$15,000: Illustrated manga chapter + art book combo! [UNLOCKED!]
$20,000: Katakana & Hiragana flash cards! [UNLOCKED!]
ADD-ONS
You can add an extra amount to your pledge to receive the following goodies. You can do this anytime after backing the project via the BackerKit survey we will send out when the campaign wraps up!
  Learn how to write each Katakana character!
Japanese is an exciting and interesting language. It looks a bit complicated to learn, right? After all, there's all those weird and wonderful written characters to memorize. Where do you even start to learn them? How do you remember which is which? If you're asking yourself those questions, don't worry – that's completely normal!  
The best way to learn a new language is with a learning tool that's going to keep you interested, challenge you at the right pace, and most importantly, keep you coming back for more. Learn Japanese To Survive! Katakana War is your ticket to easy Japanese learning!
Follow along with the story in between lessons!
What is Katakana?
The Japanese language combines 3 different sets of characters to form written works: Hiragana, Katakana and Kanji.
This game focuses solely on Katakana, which is frequently used to write words with a foreign origin, as well as names of people, places and things. That makes it incredibly useful!
With this game, you'll learn to read and write every single Katakana character! You'll master pronunciation and be able to write words in no time at all.
How does the game work?
At the start of each of the game's chapters, you'll learn a new set of Katakana characters. Following that, you're free to go on adventures and explore.
You'll encounter dangerous enemies that have taken the shape of Katakana. To defeat them, you'll need to correctly translate them! If you give the wrong answer, you won't deal any damage. It's a learn & live situation!
Translate the enemy Katakana to deal damage!
On your adventures, you'll also learn Japanese vocabulary! You'll see how Japanese words are constructed with Katakana, and the translations of useful words and phrases.
Luckily, you're not alone on your adventure. You'll make friends who will study with you and join you in battle. If you bring them along on lots of adventures, your friendship will strengthen and they'll unlock powerful abilities.
Explore a modern world crawling with enemies!
 Character introduction!
Game features
An exciting story based around the concept of learning Japanese. Save Japan from an invasion of shape-shifting monsters!
Learn every single Katakana character, with detailed instructions on how to read and write each character.
Visual animations display how to write each character.
Audio speech examples demonstrate how to pronounce each character.
Exciting gameplay with familiar RPG elements – collect items, complete quests, engage in battles!
Form new friendships and get to know each character with unlockable story sequences.
Earn experience points and level up your characters.
Review completed lessons to brush up on your knowledge.
In-game quizzes to test what you're learning.
Get to know each character!
  Learn Japanese vocabulary!
Backer rewards
In addition to the rewards listed below, our stretch goals have also unlocked extra rewards!
Stretch Goal Summary:
$12AUD and above: Hiragana Battle Study Guide (Digital PDF), Manga/Art Book (Digital PDF), Hiragana & Katakana Flash Cards (Digital - for self printing)
$45AUD and above: Physical paperback Manga/Art Book, in addition to all the above
$70AUD: A second copy of the paperback Manga/Art Book, in addition to all the above
Ready to learn Japanese? You bet you are!
Learn Japanese To Survive! Katakana War is on track for release on PC & Mac in February, 2017. Back this project to receive updates and some sweet rewards!
While you wait for the release date, why not check out the first game in the series, Learn Japanese To Survive! Hiragana Battle? It's available now on Steam – click here to check it out! It's a solid introduction to the language, and will make you even more prepared to play Katakana War.
Stretch goals
$7,500: Partial voice acting! Each major character in the game will have approx. 100 lines of situational dialogue recorded. In addition, key story scenes will be fully voiced!
$10,000: Two new playable characters! Selected by a vote from all backers. These characters will fit into the story and will also include voice acting as per the above stretch goal.
$15,000: Illustrated manga chapter + art book combo! See this project update: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/136646366/learn-japanese-to-survive-katakana-war/posts/1644008
$20,000: Katakana & Hiragana flash cards! See this project update: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/136646366/learn-japanese-to-survive-katakana-war/posts/1649756
Acknowledgements:
Trailer's music courtesy of Maou Damashii, Japan.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've learned a lot from our last successful Kickstarter project!

Hiragana Battle was praised by the gaming community, but there was definitely room for improvement. We're throwing a lot more effort into Katakana War to please newcomers and hardcore gamers alike.

Our last game managed to meet the promised release date and rollout on Steam. We shipped some physical rewards too, which proved very popular.

So, even though we've done this before, there will always be challenges. We're going to run a larger beta program this time around to catch errors early on, instead of patching the game after release.

We are actively seeking feedback from backers and fans. Tell us what you want to see in the game, and most importantly, tell us what works for you and what doesn't.

With your help, we can create an educational game that is a joy to play and a pleasure to learn with!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We’re setting out to produce and publish a new edition of Italian illustrator LRNZ’s out-of-print VIEWPOINT art book series. Originally printed in extremely limited quantities of three separate volumes, available only in Italy, we are hoping to produce a brand new, 120+ page collection of the most inspiring pieces from that library, combined with new and never before seen pieces produced in the years since the original run.
This oversized, 9x12" gallery-quality art book will be printed on heavy woodfree paper with a thick, un-coated card stock cover emblazoned with glossy foil-stamped elements.
Mockup only - Not final cover design
 DOWNLOAD a FREE 30 page PDF sampler!
FREE PDF sampler available on Noisetrade!
    (mockup spread only)
  LRNZ is the penname of artist and designer Lorenzo Ceccotti, who has made waves throughout the different fields of visual art around the world. Hailing from Rome, Italy, he is a founding member of the collective SuperAmici studio and BRUTUS/CHIMP Co. He was animation director for the documentary “The Dark Side of the Sun,” concept artist on the live action sci-fi short film "The Nostalgist," and production designer for both the graphic novel and upcoming live action feature film “Monolith” due for release this year.
Robot design for The Nostalgist
With a passion for music, video games, animation, and film, he has blended all of these inspirations into a unique visual style that mixes line art, painted brushwork, and graphic design. His work sets him apart within a peer group of masters such as Terada, Moebius, Otomo, Bilal, Darrow, Madureira, Steranko, Sienkiewicz, and Stout.
He has also applied this talent to storytelling, with a handful of short comic book stories leading up to his first full-length graphic novel, GOLEM, which has been translated into numerous languages to date. It is a 280-page tale filled with sci-fi adventure, futuristic intrigue, political commentary, and spiritual metaphor using the universal archetype of visual storytelling: sequential art.
 GOLEM was published in English by Magnetic Press, who proudly introduced this spectacular visionary work to North American audiences.
  Being a small, self-funded independent publishing company, Magnetic Press is looking to raise funds to cover the printing costs of what will undoubtedly be a beautiful library edition art book by an emerging, influential artistic figurehead. To encourage your support of this exciting project, we’re offering a number of backing tiers to choose from, with a variety of rewards for your help:
Mockup only - Not final cover design
A copy of the finished book with bookplate signed by the artist ($30 Retail Value)  NOW a 200 page HARDCOVER! SAME PRICE!
Mockup only - Not final design
A fashionable Tee Shirt designed by the artist ($20 Retail Value)
A copy of GOLEM, with a promotional poster and sticker sheet. ($20 Retail Value)
Mockup only - Not final selection
A portfolio of six poster-sized, 10x14” textured cardstock lithograph prints. This set will be limited to less than 100 (or enough to fulfill backer demand).  ($50 Retail Value)
  Examples only - actual rewards will be original works
A limited number of original pencil, ink, and digitally painted commissions will also be made available to premiere backers
Digital editions of the finished Viewpoint and/or the complete Golem graphic novel will also be available to nearly all tiers. ($12 Retail Value each)
"A LA CARTE" ITEMS CAN NOW BE ADDED TO YOUR PLEDGE!
You can now add extra items to your rewards package by increasing your pledge but keeping the same reward tier. Message us with the list of items you are adding to your pledge and we’ll make sure they are added to your reward! Get your Christmas shopping done early!
NOTE: Add-ons can now be added to your pledge when filling out the survey with BACKERKIT! This will make adding and changing your information easier to track!
EARLY PLEDGE INCENTIVE!
While we appreciate your interest in following the campaign, what we really need is your financial support. So to encourage you to pledge early, rather than "star for later", we're including a LIMITED EDITION 5x7" textured cardstock print to the first 250 backers at the $30 tier and above.  We will only print 250 of these, just enough for those backers who help us reach our initial goal.
THANKS TO YOUR SUPPORT, THESE ARE ALL NOW CLAIMED!
    Based on previous experience producing books such as this, with actual quotes from vendors, as well as experience running and fulfilling three previous successful Kickstarter campaigns, we're confident that our goal amount will cover what is necessary to print and ship a minimum print run of this book.  Half will go towards fees and fulfillment, with the remainder going towards printing costs.  Should we raise more than our minimum goal, the costs will change, but the proportion will stay roughly the same. 
While our original goal will allow us to release the new 120 page softcover edition of this art collection, we have planned a set of stretch goals to further encourage your support, including additional pages (up to 200!) and a premium hardcover edition!This deluxe version will be the same book contents, but wrapped in a lush hardcover casing with a classy ribbon book mark.
ALL GOALS MET! 200 pages and Hardcover for everyone!
                Magnetic Press was formed in 2014 by Mike Kennedy and Wes Harris, both former publishers at other well-established comic book companies, as an opportunity to showcase amazing artists and creators from around the world who they felt had not yet reached a deserving audience in the US/North America.
First year releases included NAJA, MEKA, and LUMINAE from artist Bengal (who went on to become a frequent contributor at both DC and Marvel, with regular and celebrated contributions to BATGIRL, SUPERGIRL, ALL-NEW WOLVERINE, and most recently SPIDER-GWEN). This was followed by DOOMBOY and A GLANCE BACKWARD by artist Tony Sandoval, who collected Eisner nominations for both titles, as well as a 2016 Eisner nomination for Best Painter/Multimedia Artist. Other extraordinary visual artists introduced by Magnetic Press include Matteo De Longis (VOX), Eisner-nominated Federico Bertolucci (for the LOVE series), Joel Jurion (KLAW), Djet (POET ANDERSON), and Miki Montllo (WARSHIP JOLLY ROGER).
"Do backers at the $25 Early Bird tier get the Limited Edition 'first 250' print too?"
ABSOLUTELY! The first 250 backers at any tier that includes a physical shipment are included! (Sorry digital-only backers... still time to upgrade for yours!)
"Why is International shipping so expensive? The shipping is as much as the book alone! It's a lot cheaper to order things on Amazon..."
Yeah, shipping costs are rough, but that's really the most affordable rate to ship outside the US. Having shipped three other campaigns now, and regularly shipping internationally through our webstore, we've become pretty familiar with all of the options to different countries and the shipping rates that are attached to the tiers are the best we can do without actually losing money (which defeats the purpose of a fundraising campaign)... we've seen dozens, if not hundreds, of other Kickstarters that failed to account for how expensive international shipping really is, and it hurt them. The rates we've attached are genuinely what it costs! In fact, to some territories, it will probably be much more ($60 in some cases!), but we wanted to offer the most fair average rate. Wish we had a better answer or solution, but that's the sad truth of international postage these days. Companies like Amazon not only have warehouses all around the world, but HUGE bulk rates and their own fleet of planes, trains, and automobiles to keep their costs down. Not us, unfortunately.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although Magnetic Press has released a number of well-respected, high-quality, hardcover artbooks and graphic novels, with over 24 releases since our first release in 2014, each project has been funded completely out-of-pocket. We are only two people managing every detail and aspect of the publishing pipeline, from translation to layout to print production, shipping, and distribution, as well as all marketing and PR efforts. It is a time-consuming passion, and we have loads of experience producing excellent, celebrated books, but we are constantly facing the challenge of gathering the funds necessary to put these beautiful projects together.

All of LRNZ’s content already exists. The only thing preventing this book from going to press is funding the cost of printing and shipment. Should we hit our goal, we will be able to upload to the printer within 2-3 weeks of campaign completion, with books then expected to be in-hand by mid-October. There is very little, outside of unexpected force majeur, that would delay fulfillment past November.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Fantasy. Mystery. Science Fiction. Romance. We know these genres from TV and comics and more, but in Genrenauts, each genre is also a world unto itself, inhabited by archetypal characters and filled with the tropes we all know and love.
When stories on these worlds go off-track, you send in the Genrenauts. This team of narrative specialists travels across dimensions to find, analyze, and fix broken stories. If they don't, the ripples manifest as violence and upheaval in our own world (when Science Fiction World goes off-track, scientific innovation stagnates and exploration halts; when Fantasy World goes off-track, xenophobia rises and cultural rifts widen, etc.).
Stand-up comedian Leah Tang is recruited to join the Genrenauts as stories are breaking at a record pace. Will she adapt to the bizarre and dangerous life of a Genrenaut, or will she end up as just another broken story?
Introduction
Hi! I'm Michael R. Underwood, an author, podcaster, and publishing professional. I've written seven books across the science fiction & fantasy genres, including the Ree Reyes geeky urban fantasy series (Geekomancy, Celebromancy, Attack the Geek, Hexomancy), weird fantasy superhero novel Shield and Crocus, and supernatural thriller The Younger Gods. You might also know me from Hugo-finalist The Skiffy & Fanty Show, Speculate! The Podcast for Writers, Readers, and Fans, or as the Sales & Marketing Manager at Angry Robot Books. I'm coming to Kickstarter for Genrenauts, a series of science fiction adventure novellas.

Some backstory:

In November 2015, I launched The Shootout Solution, the first episode in Genrenauts, a science fiction series in novellas. Episode two - The Absconded Ambassador - followed in February of 2016. And in April, Tor.com published "There Will Always Be a Max," a Genrenauts short story.

For more on the series, here's a video introduction:

The first two episodes were released with Tor.com Publishing, and they did a great job launching the series and helping get the word out. 

But honestly, I’m champing at the bit to get these stories out to readers. Genrenauts was designed to feel like a weekly TV show or a radio serial, and I want to increase the speed of release to fit that feel. In discussions with Lee Harris, my editor at Tor.com, I realized that they weren’t in a position to publish four more Genrenauts novellas in 2016 in order to get the whole season out this year, so we agreed that I’d go ahead and publish the rest of the season myself. They have been and remain very supportive of the series.

There Will Always Be a Max - Art by Goñi Montes
  Now I’m coming to you, the Wonderful People of the Internet, to ask for your help in continuing the series. All six episodes of Season One are written. Episode 3 is ready to publish, and Episode 4 is in final edits. The cost of publishing these novellas on my own, to the same standard as Tor.com Publishing has set, will be high.

The Campaign
Therefore, I’ve decided to run a Kickstarter campaign to fund a Complete Genrenauts Season One Collection, including Episodes 1-6 and special extras (approximately 170,000 words in total). If we succeed, I will be able to publish ebook and paperback editions of the complete first season. And with stretch goals, possibly even audiobooks for Episodes 3-6. The very flexible contract terms with Tor.com Publishing explicitly allow me to publish this collected edition, and I’m really excited to bring it to life. 


Episode Guide 
In Genrenauts, each book is an 'episode,' organized into 'seasons' of six episodes each. Each episode tells its own story, while building a season arc and the overall arc of the series. The series is planned to run five seasons in total. 


Here's a run-down of season one:

The Shootout Solution
  Episode 1 - The Shootout Solution – Struggling stand-up comic Leah Tang is offered a once-in-a-lifetime chance to join the Genreauts as they head to the Western world to stop a bandit posse on the rampage. But the Western’s hero isn’t interested in winning, and the safety of Earth hangs in the balance… (Read a free excerpt)


The Absconded Ambassador
  Episode 2 - The Absconded Ambassador – When a breach is discovered in Science Fiction World, Leah gets her first taste of space flight. A peace treaty is about to be signed on space station Ahura-3, guaranteeing the end of hostilities between some of the galaxy’s most ferocious races, but when the head architect of the treaty is unexpectedly kidnapped, it’s up to Leah and her new colleagues to save the day. (Read a free excerpt)
    The Cupid Reconciliation cover

Episode 3 – The Cupid Reconciliation – Wounded Genrenaut Mallery York returns to active duty just in time for the team to deploy to the Romantic Comedy story region. Mallery takes the lead, bringing her expertise to bear as the team plots a grand reunion between two estranged lovers – hacking social networks, running confidence games, and doing whatever it takes to make sure the story ends in Happily Ever After.

Episode 4 – The Substitute Sleuth – A scouting mission to the Police Procedural region of Crime World becomes a scramble to fill the shoes of detective archetypes in order to solve a pair of nested mysteries. King and Leah become an odd-couple-style pair of detectives. But there's more going on here than a simple crime of passion...

Episode 5 & 6 – The Failed Fellowship – The two-part season finale! Our team travels to Traditional Fantasy-land where the prophesied hero has died just before his moment of triumph. The Genrenauts have to take on the roles of Wizard, Paladin, Bard, and more. They'll need to find a new MacGuffin in order to defeat the Night-Lord before his arcane power brings about an eternal night of terror. In Episode 5, the heroes arrive in the story world and seek the new MacGuffin. In Episode 6, they confront the Night-Lord and uncover a secret with implications across the multiverse.

Some reviews for Genrenauts:

 “A clever, exciting, and seriously fun twist on portal fantasy…Sign me up to be a Genrenaut, too!” 
–Delilah S. Dawson, author of the Blud series, Hit, and Wake of Vultures, written as Lila Bowen 


“I have this sinking feeling that the Genrenauts series, with its raucous meta-commentary upon the stories of pop culture, is going to say important things that I might not be clever enough to catch the first time around because I’m too busy enjoying the books.” 
–Howard Tayler, Hugo Award winner and creator of Schlock Mercenary 

 “…a rollicking exploration of western tropes, with hints of a larger conspiracy afoot. Underwood has plans for a lot more of these, and I can’t wait to read them.” 
–Joel Cunningham, B&N Sci-Fi & Fantasy Blog 

 “In a real sense, [Genrenauts] will help make me a reader more cognizant and aware of conventions and devices in genre fiction, making me a savvier reader for it.” 
-Paul Weimer, SF Signal 

 “…it’s a heck of a lot of fun the way Galaxy Quest is: a little goofy, a little serious but not taking itself too seriously, and filled with a fondness for the source material that gives it weight without weighing down the story.” 
-Samantha Holloway, New York Journal of Books

Breakdown of costs:
Breakdown of costs
34% = Editing - This pays for professional developmental edits, copyedits, and proofing for Episodes 3-6.
12% = Art & Design-  This pays for the cover art/design for the omnibus.
25% = Printing- This pays for printing the estimated first batch of print editions to fulfill the campaign.
16% = Shipping - This pays to ship the physical rewards.
5% = Formatting & Title Costs - This pays for getting the omnibus set up in retailer systems to sell after the Kickstarter rewards are fulfilled.
8% = Fees - This covers Kickstarter's portion as well as credit card processing fees.


Stretch Goals
UNLOCKED! - 150 Backers - STORY WORLD DOSSIERS – If we reach 150 backers to the project, I will create a separate ebook (approximately 10,000 words) of genre analyses for the genres visited in season one (Western, Space-based Science Fiction, Romantic Comedy, Odd Couple Police Procedural, and Traditional Fantasy). Each essay will talk about the (sub)genre in question, its thematic and cultural uses on earth, and how I worked it into the Genrenauts universe. All backer levels receiving ebook editions of the Season One omnibus will receive DRM-free copies of the Story World Dossiers.

UNLOCKED - 200 Backers - HARDCOVER EDITION! I've added the SPECIALIST backer level for a signed & numbered limited hardcover of the Season One Omnibus. You can also upgrade your paperback copy to a hardcover - instructions below.

We'll bring back acclaimed audiobook performer, puppeteer, and multiple Hugo Award Winner Mary Robinette Kowal, who performed the audiobook for Episodes One and Two, as well as Celebromancy and Attack the Geek from my Ree Reyes series. 

Mary and her audio producer are excited to continue with Genrenauts, so they're giving me a competitive rate. Like any professionals, they must be paid for their time and expertise, and quality audiobooks are expensive to produce. These stretch goals are the lowest I can reasonably set them, and will include personal investment from me for each - but I really love audio fiction, and want to make these happen.

$12,500 - EPISODE FOUR AUDIOBOOK – At this level, we will be able to pay to record Episode Four – The Substitute Sleuth, as well.

Whimsy Goals
Those that know me may be aware that I am a fan of whimsy. And I am not afraid to be shameless in order to support this campaign. to that end, here are some whimsy goals:

YOUTHFUL EMBARRASSMENT - If the campaign reaches 300 backers, I will record a reading of some of my early fiction, including stories written in college. It will be embarrassing, and it will be awesome.

HAMILTON COVER - If we sell out of the NARRATIVE TRAINING ($250) OR GENRENAUTS CONSULTATION ($500) backer levels during the campaign, I will post a video of me covering "You’ll be Back" from the Hamilton musical. campaign.story:
Glow is a new ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Dia Ja and Anny Maulina. Glow is Mythopoeia’s second comic series after the Kickstarter-supported Skies of Fire. 
The goal of this Kickstarter is to raise both production and print funds for the creation of Glow #1. We currently have 10 pages already done, but need completion funds to bring the rest of the project to fruition. Any additional funds we raise beyond our goal will go directly towards further issues of the series. 
Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world.
With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world.
Until one day the Towers fell. 
The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain.

Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Colm Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger.  
Besides helping to inform us about the history and culture of the world, we plan on implementing Nymeran in several interesting ways.
Rune scavenging plays a huge role in the world of Glow. Ancient Nymeran technology is constantly bartered and fought over in the Wastes. Simple runes contain just a single character, while more complicated runes are combinations - or phrases - amalgamated together in an intricate design.
The rune, phonetic, and translation of a phrase in Nymeran, all created by Colm.
We pass along the created runic phrase to Anny, who then creates an intricate, calligraphic runic design for the complete piece:
    Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they’re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London.
Dia Ja was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She graduated at Los Angeles County High School for the Arts in 2014, and is currently attending ArtCenter College of Design for Illustration. Check out her tumblr. 
Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia, currently working as a fulltime environment artist at Tinker Games based in Bandung. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her at http://n-maulina.deviantart.com.
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Aftershock's InSexts. @bryan_valenza
Nic J Shaw is a writer, letterer, and graphic designer. His work can be found everywhere - no seriously, Nic seems to know everyone. He lives in Sydney, Australia with his fiancée and their schnauzer, Archer. You can find him @nicjshaw
From Ireland, Colm Ó Dúill is a verification specialist at TransferWise's office in Tallinn, Estonia, where he has lived since 2007. He holds an M.Phil. in Applied Linguistics and a B.Comm with French, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Linguistics. He is married with two children, and has been dabbling in creating constructed languages since 2005; Nymeran is his first developed constructed language.
Kendrick See is a full time concept artist and illustrator from Malaysia. He is currently working in the video game industry, and his job scope ranges from creating various idea development pieces, to breakdowns and 3D paintovers. He helped bring Shoddai to life with a map! http://sourshade.deviantart.com/
Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! http://nondev.deviantart.com/
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. He helped bring together many of the technological designs found in Glow. http://wingsofwrath.deviantart.com/

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 4th crowdfunding project on Kickstarter. While we haven't been mistake-free, each successive Kickstarter builds on the lessons learned from the previous. At this point we're fairly confident in our workflow and ability to deliver rewards. 

The biggest individual challenge for this Kickstarter is managing a team of artists from all over the world. We mostly live in different timezones, so coordinating is a huge logistical challenge. We have several more pages of production art to get through before this book is realized, but we've done it before with Skies of Fire. 

Because this is a production + print crowdfunding campaign, we're asking for a little bit more patience if/when we successfully fundraise our goal. No matter what happens though we'll be sure to always keep our backers in the loop!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"Little" is a collection of re-imagined pop culture characters when they were kids - printed in a collectible art book. The book will have mostly black and white drawings sprinkled with red accent colors for characters that begged for extra TLC. I've been working on these pop culture characters for about eighteen months on and off. At first it was just for fun but then it grew into and obsession.  After tabling at a hand full of "Cons" and selling hundreds of them - I realized I had to put them in this book.
If we reach $25k I'm going to have all 100 characters printed up into a 16" x 20" poster of "Little". I'll included it in each package from $40 pledge levels and up. It will be folded and fit in with your book(s) and prints like the posters we used to get in magazines back in the day. 
I'm still working on the characters so I'll post updates after the KS is over with new drawings in place of the question marks. 
If you are pledged at a lower level you can always manage your pledge to a higher level to get the poster if you want it.  
This will be my bestest and final stretch goal!. To say thank you to everyone who pledged at the physical reward levels I decided to include these three 8x10 prints in EVERY order if we reach $35K! I'm going to need your help to get the word out - I know we can do it!
...............................
I've been illustrating all my life and eventually became a freelance children's book illustrator. I took my passion for creating children's art to the world of pop culture characters. 
This book will have 120 pages complete with all 100 characters and quotes from each character on the opposite pages. I'll also include rejected ideas, process sketches, and a bit about how I created these images on the iPad Pro and on my Wacom Cintiq monitor. 
Below are characters that will appear in the book as well as on prints for some of the reward levels. 
Each illustration was drawn at 11x14 at 300dpi so there is a lot of detail reflected in each print.
All of my prints are on high quality acid free heavy print stock and all of them fit standard frame sizes: 8x10, 11x14, 18x24. Below is the Star poster framed by my local frame store.
I will be updating this kickstarter as I complete new characters to reach the finish line of 100 characters total.
Thank you and if you like my project please share it - and please check out more of my work at my website: http://willterry.com/
Here is a link to my online illustration school at https://svslearn.com/

updates.update_content:
Hi Guys,
Just wanted to let you know that I received the proof files for the book and everything is looking better than I imagined! The designer I went with wasn't cheap but I'm so glad that I built it into the production cost and I think you will be too. Even though I know my way around PS and Adobe products I couldn't have done half the job that Maralee Oleson Nelson did. http://mgraphicdesign.com/

Hey guys - just wanted to let you know where I am on this project. I just finished illustration #96 pictured here. That means only 4 more to go and I'll definitely be finished by the end of July! With a print date of Aug 1st we should have no problem getting the book finished and shipping should take place in Sept/Oct. 
Maralee Oleson has started laying out the book. She's a very competent designer and I know she'll put the polish on this book that I wouldn't be able to do. There are some extra sections that I've been working on that I teased in the original KS video.

I can't thank you guys enough. This was a dream project and you made it come true! Now that we have the funding in place I'll be able to schedule a print date with Press Media here in Provo Utah to print the books, poster, and prints as we made all the stretch goals too. I've also retained the graphic design services of Maralee Oleson Nelson - a highly skilled artist who will lay out the book and prepare it for printing.
I still have about a dozen more characters to illustrate before we send this off to the printer at the beginning of August. I'll post them on all my social media accounts as I finish them over the next few months.

campaign.story:
Story:
GIRRION is a sweeping sci-fi fantasy story of a hero's journey in a distant world in a distant time. The saga is told through the eyes of Jarra, a poor factory worker who dreams of escaping his world of endless toil. His wish comes true, though not in a way he would have ever wanted, when his city is attacked by a dark entity called the Halodron. He escapes the conflict, but only to be thrust into a war of other-worldy magic and weaponry.
Amidst the destruction, history begins to unravel as soldiers of a forgotten war resurface and the secrets of a mysterious technology known as Girrion come to light as its scattered remains suddenly start to “reawaken”. With little time and resources, the hero must help save his crumbling empire from its destructive past.
New to Girrion? Not to worry! All issues will be available in this campaign.
GIRRION Book 1 The Chrysalis and the Stone is approximately 200 pages long, and is the first installment of a three-book series. Currently Issue 1- 3 are complete (pages 1 - 78). This Kickstarter is for the production of Issue 4 and 5 (pages 79 -130), but I am including previous books in some of the rewards as well.
Why two issues?
Normally I won't be doing more than one issue per Kickstarter. I'm doing this only because of the way the story plays out. Without spoiling anything, there are some important upcoming scenes and it will be better for the reader to get both of issues at once. I think it would just be more enjoyable. 
Follow the project: 
website: www.girrion.com
twitter: www.twitter.com/Girrion1
instagram: www.instagram.com/girrion1/
Age Range: (PG - PG-13 )
- No sex or bad language
- No excessive gore. Girrion is primarily about a war so there is cartoon violence similar to the level of Star Wars, but more of it.
Samples from Issue 1:
Rewards / Book Format:
Softcover books are glossy and have some weight to them. They are not the flimsy thin type like some of the standard comics seen at stores.
The interior art is full color and has a watercolor feel.
Longterm goals (Outside of this campaign)
My main goal is of course to finish the graphic novel. This is something I've spent years and years developing and plan to spend many more years to complete. So far I've enjoyed publishing them through Kickstarter so there is no reason to stop.
I think Girrion would be great for video games and animation as well. Hopefully after the book is complete that is something to look forward to! I've actually already started working with 3D artist on making some character figurines.
First Girrion 3D model (not actual 3D print)
Additional Rewards
After selecting a reward tier you can add these options on top of it. Just add the additional amount during the pledge and message me personally to let me know.
6" x 9" Concept art - signed vehicle Illustration on sketch paper (pencil or ink)   $50
Special Thanks
Music for animation : Kahan James
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being that this is not the first comic I've made there aren't too many major challenges with getting the book made, but there are some small ones:

Learning from the last Kickstarter campaign there were some things I had to learn in terms of submitting art to the book printer. If anything was even a little off with art files, it meant delays. Being that I have more experience dealing with them - there should be less problems this time around.

Some of the artwork on certain pages goes fast, some takes very long. There are some complex scenes in this issue with lots of characters and elements that need strong design. Again from past experience the artwork can sometimes take a bit longer than expected. Also, keep in mind I have to mix this work in with the day job.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The content will be finished and sealed with the stamp of approval from the Robo-President by the end of August. The production will be done in early September, followed by a quality check on every book and extras, and the packaging phase. 
By the first of October the shipping phase will begin, and by the end of the month all the proud Robo-Citizen will have their packages.
Thank you for your cooperation.
Long live the Robo-President! Glory to the Machine!

campaign.story:
In the year 2025, the United States government sends a group of astronauts to the moon in search of precious helium-3. Their mission soon turns upside-down after their discovery of the ruins of an ancient human colony from half a millennium ago. A secret organization led by a mysterious man on Earth will stop at nothing to make sure the Lunar One crew does not learn of this ancient race. Throughout this conflict, links to mythological events arise in this world of intrigue and secrecy. Prepare to unravel the mysteries that lie on the EDGE OF EXTINCTION.
EOE #4 Stretch Goal Bonus Rewards
ISSUE 1 - Set in the distant future of 2025. The main characters and future technologies are introduced. NASA launches a historic mission to send 8 astronauts to the Moon in search of Helium-3. Certain challenges and discoveries arise, as this epic story begins.
ISSUE 2 - The Lunar One Team reaches the Moon. However, there are injuries among the crew. A new villain is revealed. Some of the relationships among the crew grow stronger, as discoveries are made.
ISSUE 3 - This chapter begins with an ancient discovery. The villain and his organization’s mission begin to come to light, as Jimbo and his crew make an even bigger find on the Moon.

The Chasing Arrows Issue #1 will be a double-sized 40 page full color comic printed on recycled paper. All pages have been completed! But I need your help! This Kickstarter is to help print the first issue.

Cover by Joe Nash
Love this page! -- Bonus page I promised from the next issue: The Chasing Arrows Issue #0.
The Chasing Arrows story explores a future where earth has flooded and floating garbage patches, known as middens, cover the seas. The story will follow two main characters, Inara and Onas.
Both Inara and Onas are Chasing Arrows, people who scavenge the middens and lead lives of thrift. To be a Chasing Arrow is to follow the Old Codes and The Way of the Arrow. To be a Chasing Arrow is to find use for the useless, to readdress the value of things, and to indeed find trash to be treasure.
Inara and Onas are orphans who live on Kaisei Atoll, a floating island of scrap located in the Trash Belt Doldrums. Onas spends his days diving for scrap on the middens while Inara works as an engineer in the Underbelly of the atoll.
Onas
Inara
I started writing The Chasing Arrows in prose. As I was writing it I realized I was spending huge amounts of time world building and writing long winded descriptions (two things that can get a novel writer in trouble). I wanted the story to have really cool magic system too. What I came up with was a system based on color. With all this in mind I realized a graphic novel would work great for this story and give me an excuse to do all the really fun novelty things behind making a story world (writing these long descriptions now as a script for my illustrator [I'm pretty sure I drive him crazy], making maps, drawing character sheets, seeing my characters come to life on the page, actually seeing the color of the magic system, and just in general being able to address the novelty book aspect with the story). I'm the kind of person who thinks the backmatter in a comic book is so frikkin' awesome.
I also think the health of our planet is important! As should we all! My characters fight for this, as I do, and as all the real Chasing Arrows of this world do!
The Chasing Arrows is an ongoing story. The first story arc will most likely be 8 issues.
The Trash Belt: Made up of floating islands of trash known as middens. The middens circle the Tear in never ending drift. The Trash Belt is modeled after real life trash gyres.
The Tear: Asteroid-like landmass jutting from the sea. The Tear flooded the world long ago (this time was known as The Weeping). The Tear is about twice the size of Mount Everest to give an idea of scale. The Tear is at the center of the Inner Circle. The Inner Circle is the densest area of the Trash Belt. Earthquake-like atmosphere (midden-mass constantly shifting). Electrical storms. Serpents. Untraveled by humans.
The Himalayan Islands: Some of the last remaining area of dry land. Also known as the Mainland or Roof of the World. The Crescent Empire and other rich noble houses reside here.
Kaisei Atoll: Floating island made up of scrap and old boats from the Time Before. Located in the Trash Belt Doldrums. Inara and Onas live here. The Underbelly is the underwater area of the atoll.
The Kelp Islands: Islands consisting entirely of mutated kelp. Ever shifting tides here. Rumored to be slave islands controlled by the Crescent Empire.
The Coral City: Mutated Great Barrier Reef. Now jutting five hundred feet above sea surface. Inhabited by humans?

campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino, Bryan Valenza, and Nic J Shaw. Skies was launched in on Kickstarter and subsequently releases each new issue on the platform. 
This Kickstarter's goal is to raise funds to print issue #3. Any additional funds will go directly into the production of issue #4 and the reprinting of #1-2. 
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince.
His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.
In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.
Issue Three follows the pair as they continue assembling the rest of the crew for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead.
Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou have been creating stories together since 2008. They met in college and continue to collaborate despite being 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art. His work can be found in publications from Mythopoeia to Marvel to Boom! He recently moved to Valencia where he now draws full time.  
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Aftershock's InSexts. 
Nic J Shaw is a writer, letterer, and graphic designer. His work can be found everywhere - no seriously, Nic seems to know everyone. He lives in Sydney, Australia with his fiancée and their schnauzer, Archer. 
Josephe Vandel is a German cartographer and graphic designer with a love for RPGs and creating fictional worlds.
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army.
Pawel Fotek is a self taught artist from Poland who jumped on the art train pretty late, at the age of 21. Since his early years he's always scribbled on the back of his notebooks during most classes. After graduating from high school, Pawel went to study economics at a local university, yet deep inside he felt that it's wasn't something he'd like to pursue in life, and that place was only ensuring him in his beliefs. One cold winter morning he woke up and simply decided to quit the uni and train very hard to become a professional artist. He has not looked back ever since. 
The Skies of Fire team stands by their policy of transparency when it comes to crowdfunding. The funds for this Kickstarter will be used as follows:
Skies of Fire is printed in a beautiful 8x11" oversized format that showcases the incredible talent of our artists. The size harkens to a European aesthetic, reflecting the diverse background of the people working on the project.
 In addition to the story, each issue contains a 3-4 page codex in the back of the book. The codex provides additional background and context to the world much like an old school video game manual or tabletop rulebook.
The Aquilan Calendar by Alex Bucur.
Variant covers give us an opportunity to showcase and collaborate with artists whose work otherwise might not be shown in comics. For issue two, our variant cover is done by the extremely talented Pawel Fotek with letters by Alex Bucur.
Get your poster copy of the variant with the "I want you in royal blue" slogan!
We mail our comics bagged and boarded in sturdy chipboard mailers. Chipboard mailers are incredibly durable and almost impossible to bend. They'll keep the comics safe as they're in transit to you while the bags and boards will ensure they'll continue to remain in mint condition for years to come.
The rest of our of packaging includes three inch diameter cardboard tubes for posters and cardboard parcel packages for large orders, along with bubble wrap.
 See a closeup of our Poster Prints here. 
To purchase Add-Ons, simply add the amount in red to your order. Additionally, you may also wait until the end of the campaign and purchase add-ons through BackerKit, where you will be able to select additional a la carte items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information.
Show your allegiance with a KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE wax seal on your issue today!
If you are adding-on a poster print and are based outside of the US, please add the following amount for shipping ONLY IF you do not have any other posters included in your backer reward:
Canada / Mexico: $10
United Kingdom / EU: $6
Rest of World: $14
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our 3rd Kickstarter project and at this point we have a good idea of what to expect before, during, and after the campaign. The main challenge we've faced in our past two is delivery - we strive always to deliver rewards to our backers in a timely manner, and though we've gotten faster each time, there is still room for improvement. 

For this campaign we plan on ordering the books as soon as we have a good guess about the demand, potentially 1-2 weeks in. We also plan on streamlining the logistics for some of our higher-end reward tiers, and are looking into the possibility of a fulfillment service if the demand is great enough. 

The production of issue three is completely done, so the timeline is all about printing and shipping the books.

Version Française / Versión española / English Version
What if you had an unlimited access to the LARGEST ONLINE MOVIE LIBRARY EVER? A community based library, where you could watch any movie online. A library where you could swap films with contributors all over the world and discover an infinite number of stories. This is the revolutionary idea behind MovieSwap.
To make such a dream come true, we worked on a collaborative and crowdsourced approach. Why? Because during the last 15 years, over 25 billion DVDs were sold worldwide. Those movies are now waiting for a second life and MovieSwap is the solution. 
Today, we're all set... but definitely need your support to make it real. Are you ready to free the movies with us?
MovieSwap will be a subscription-based service... BUT all of the Kickstarter backers will be considered "founding members": they will be granted a 6 months exclusive full access to the early beta version available this summer... and then they will get FREE access to MovieSwap for LIFE. 
MovieSwap will be available on PC, Mac, Android tablets and of course on TV thanks to our HDMI SwapStick.
It's simple and fair: It's exactly like in real life, when you trade a book, swap clothes or give an object to a friend. With MovieSwap, you will be able to swap films with any member of the community. You want to watch a movie? Look if the film is available on the online library and swap it instantly in just one click! You don't even need to wait for the other user's approval (he already agreed to make his DVD swappable). It's that simple!
The video below shows the actual process (it's just a draft, we're still working on the User Interface):
PLAY

Users can choose to either contribute to this Kickstarter campaign and receive some DVDs in their digital library, or send in their physical DVD collections in order to enjoy them or swap them with the community. This process ensures that users are always swapping one DVD for another, thus making the process legal.
As MovieSwap is building its library from individuals’ personal collections, there will soon be the largest film choice ever, ranging from mainstream to indie titles.
Any question? Feel free to ask in the comments section.
"Hats off to the MovieSwap team for having the guts to put together something as innovative as this. It’s not only a brilliant use for a dying format but also an excellent way to make use of already-paid-for content that people have lying around their homes. There’s no doubt that the public will absolutely love this service." – TorrentFreak
"The campaign is till in its early days too, and will come to a close next month on April 15. So unless something goes drastically wrong, the campaign will be a success." - DigitalTrends
"MovieSwap on Tuesday launched a Kickstarter campaign (...) backers are promised free access for life after the service first lauches in beta this summer." - Variety
"MovieSwap says that during the last 15 years, over 25 billion DVDs were sold worldwide with many remaining unwatched. This is why the new service could become the perfect solution."   - DailyStar
My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you gonna get". Well with MovieSwap you do. Here are the details:
The process is quite simple, actually, it's fully based on those good old DVDs, that were sold by billions over the past 15 years... but are now going obsolete :(
We already collected over 200,000 DVDs in our warehouse
Because people already PAID for them, we invented a fair way to give them a brilliant second life. That's the logistical and technical basis of MovieSwap, which is ready to:
1. collect millions of DVDs from all over the world
2. register them on behalf of their owners
3. put them into the cloud
4. store them in warehouses
5. and remotely play them on any device across their personal libraries.
This beauty can take care of 300 DVDs/hour, we call it "The Monster".
Then, just like you can legally lend, swap, or offer a DVD to a friend, MovieSwap works in the same way, but on a much larger scale thanks to its remote playback technology. 
Additionally, users can get the full DVD experience including bonuses, deleted scenes, director's commentaries, and other unique features not available when streaming videos online.
The service will be available on PC, Mac, Android tablets and of course on TV thanks to our HDMI SwapStick.
The HDMI SwapStick, based on Android 5.
Our best friend is the famous VLC video player, that has been downloaded over 1 billion times in the world. Just like it allows to read a DVD on any device, it now can read them over the internet. And guess what? VLC was born in France, just like us ;)
A 15 people team is already behind the project : software engineers, warehousemen, project managers... Here are the leaders of this incredible and passionate team.
(From left to right: Cyril Barthet, Julien Navas, Chris Navas and David Honnorat)
Those four bearded friends previously founded Vodkaster, a famous social and disruptive marketplace for French movie buffs. They've been working for the last 2 years on the technology and logistics behind MovieSwap, that now can collect millions of DVDs from around the world, register, store and play them remotely to their owners on any device. They were waiting for you, guys.
Cyril Barthet, aka a Serious Man
Cyril is 40 and is leading the MovieSwap team. He likes to talk to investors, lawyers and bankers, and has a strong track record as business executive and lobbyist in the film industry. He's got a Bachelor in Management and is graduated in intellectual property law from La Sorbonne - where he now teaches film economics and disruption. A f***ing serious man.
Julien Navas, aka Mac Gyver
Julien is our master of logistics, innovations and hacks at MovieSwap. He's never got problems, but only smart solutions. Very smart, indeed. He's graduated in chemistry and process engineering. Have you ever seen a swiss knife with a big beard?
Chris Navas, aka the Architect
Chris is patiently building the technical MovieSwap foundations since 2013, after working for 10 years at Alcatel-Lucent as an R&D engineer. He would love to see a chess play between HAL from 2001: A Space Odyssey and WORP from Wargames. 
David Honnorat, aka Fantastic Mister Fox
Web-designer and film critic, David is our content guy. A few years ago he designed a subway map for the best movies of all time (using IMDb's top 250) which went viral several times since then. Unconditional fan of Steven Soderbergh, François Truffaut and Brian De Palma, David is also the co-writer of a critical analysis book about director M. Night Shyamalan. Don't get him started on the subject!
Thank you for helping us make this project come true! (You can also put a link to your creations here)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The project may look crazy... But it has the means of its ambition, and is held by an experienced team with a global and collaborative vision, which previously founded VodKaster.

MovieSwap has developed its technology and logistics for the last two years, thanks to its R&D team. It has partenered with the leading video software VLC, and already tested its business model in France with more than 200,000 DVDs already gathered. 

MovieSwap is also strongly advised and based its approach on a fully legal basis, combining two legal concepts known as "first sale doctrine" and "fair use".

Financially speaking, MovieSwap is already backed by investors that can support a quick growth and help to power up the project... But it needs first a large and enthusiastic movement from thousands of viewers from all over the world to kick it. That's your job, folks!

campaign.story:
About this project
Think how many door handles you grab on average every day. I’ll pause while you wash your hands… Think about how often you touch a door handle at a restaurant, grocery store or a movie theater. Now think about how often you touch a bathroom door handle after you wash your hands and then proceed to touch a germ infested handle on your way out; or maybe you use your shirt, sleeve or one of many creative techniques to open the door Save yourself the hassle-- and the germs, and start using Aopun. Trust us; you’ll never leave the house without it.
Design  
Aopun is a durable, light, and sizable accessory which will change how you open doors.
 Manufactured in aluminum.
Simply use the well tested hook to pull the door open. The accessory works on all types of door handles whether they are big, small, round, or flat. The device easily attaches or hooks to the handle of any door and can be seamlessly removed.
Aopun will open the heaviest and most germ infested door handles you come across. Manufactured to last, and tested on its ability to hold up to 45 pounds, Aopun will almost never bend or break due to the sleek and well-engineered design.
 Aopun also has a small hole in its base for attachment to a keychain, so you never leave it behind.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Deciding to re-launch our project presented us with unique problems, but in the time we’ve had to evaluate our previous campaign, we’ve come to unique solutions. The key issue that we encountered was finding the right manufacturer to source Aopun. We were able to find a manufacturer that could produce Aopun for a lower price while keeping the integrity of the product. Also, revaluating our packaging presented an issue in determining to re-launch. We saw our packaging created unwanted costs on us and more importantly--customers. This campaign as well as our product, we believe is much more well-crafted and cost effective. Help us, once again, deliver Aopun. Aopun: Never Touch a Door Handle Ever Again.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
There is no memory. No information what happened or why. Nothing about you, nothing about your life. You are in a world you don’t remember seeing before at a place forgotten by time and space. Wake up and explore this majestic world that has been waiting of your return so long. 
Remember your being and remember your abilities which are hidden in ancient structures. Structures that will challenge your mind with anomalous puzzles. Wander freely through these lands and beyond to find yourself. And finally discover the truth, the past and the future of places, you never believed would exist...
ESSENCE is a new cross over between an first person exploration and none violent adventure game with metroidvania elements, beautiful landscapes and interwoven open world areas.
Its as much about exploring the different worlds of ESSENCE and collecting lost fragments of the world as discovering secret places filled with mysterious messages. Also it is about solving puzzles and learning new abilities that help you proceed further on otherwise hidden paths. The further you will go the more possibilities you will have to interact with the world and its surroundings. Every world has its very own theme and therefore is different in color, gameplay and overall feeling. 
The game has a narration, that will combine classic messages from different characters with a dense environmental storytelling. By uncovering all these places and messages you will experience a story that slowly leads you closer to one much larger conclusion ...
To learn more about the gameplay, the look and feel of ESSENCE we have created a first prototype to show roughly our vision for the game. It features a handfull parts of the worlds and some features. When you have pledged, you get instant download access to our prototype (available for Win, Mac, Linux)
ESSENCE will launch on Windows, Mac, Linux ( Steam / DRM Free) and if we reach the early on stretch goal also on Xbox One and PS4 (digital). We also think it is going to be a great experience for Virtual Reality and included VR support in our early on stretch goals too.
While the prototype is only available in English the final game will be localised in several other languages. If no stretch goal is reached we will release ESSENCE in English and German. More languages will be available as subtitles. For more information please check out our stretch goals.
The gameplay of ESSENCE has many different aspects. First there is the exploration. Move freely through wide lands and breathtaking blends of nature and surrealism, interact with your surroundings and sense different feelings trought the environment itself.
The gameworld is divided into 5 huge core worlds which again have different areas and a couple of smaller sub-worlds which slightly differ in design and style. All worlds are connected with each other and form a huge universe. The core worlds follow the open world principles, which makes it possible for you to move freely through the worlds and explore ESSENCE exactly the way you want.
Here is another impression of the different worlds that you will discover in ESSENCE.
While playing Essence you will slowly learn more abilities which will help you to continue your journey. The abilities can be used in many different ways and can often open paths or reveal secrets that you have never seen before. Abilities that we are currently working on are floating and flying in some worlds, using a light ball to enlighten your way, freezing and reverting time to rebuild a setting or to create new paths and many more.
ESSENCE is packed with riddles and puzzles. Also every core world contains a huge and unique Puzzle itself that is integrated in the way you play. It might be the solution to a maze, changing gravity, a sound based puzzle or even a specific the way you can activate an item or open a new path.
Some worlds will try to keep you captive in their sheer infinity, and sometimes you will not notice that you're caught. You will have to use your skills and unusual approaches to escape from these anomalous labyrinths. 
Along your journey you will encounter enigmatic characters, whose motivations are unknown. You have to figure out who they are and what they want. Some seems to want to help you, but some are trying to keep you away from something.
Along your journey you will discover gigantic and abandoned structures. You have to revive the mechanisms of their ancient and sophisticated technology to enter them. Inside these structures it is up to your interpretation what you will discover. 
Of course, the miraculous atmosphere is only possible with an equally fitting music and ambience. We have already worked with our friends Jaye Arcuve and Richard Evans togehter to find the appropriate style for ESSENCE. Please consider this is still a early development stage, but we are looking forward to continue the collaboration and bring you true memorable moments through the soundtrack.
Also we have already some music for you that we have produced, here you can get a taste of the atmosphere. (You can also hear these themes in our prototype)
INCEPTA | SECOND BIRTH
VAPORA | LOST REMINDER
 VAPORA | ASCENT
We want to embed these and other feelings in ESSENCE. We will do everything to evoke those emotions in our players during and after gaming. We want to create a world in where you decide to go first and which will not restrict you, instead it will slowly open itself to you.  
ESSENCE will be a mesmerizing game full of wonder in which you can loose yourself simply by walking through the world, diving deep in a atmosphere, filled with feelings about ancient civilisation, arcane technology and lost philosophy...
We dare to start an attempt to bring the games medium in the direction of consummate art, and to endow it with a particular philosophical core point. And only in this way we want to convey our secret conclusion... which is determined out there for the players.  
Because our vision goes beyond creating just games...
As a little thank you for supporting us we would like to put your name on an in-game monument. The higher pledges will get more prominent places on the monument. The monument world will be playable within the actual game.
The world of ESSENCE is populated with spirits. These spirits can rather give useful tips, tell you a short story about their life or tell you a secret. Just as humans every spirit has its own character, voice and name. Once a spirit is found its name will appear on a central monument of the level. Now you can become one of these spirits. You can choose a name, color, shape and short text that the spirit should tell the player (of course the content needs to be appropriate).
Generally there are different there are 2 different kinds of spirits. 
the advising spirit: it lives at a specific place and whispers or talks  to the player once he comes close 
the companion spirit: it companies the player for a while and might even show him hidden paths. While the spirit is the companion of the player it can say several sentences. While the advising spirit is restricted to a short story or quote.
Besides the spirit there is also the possibility to become a titan. Titans are giant creatures who rule and protect the world of Essence. If you decide to become a titan we will talk with you about the designs you like and about the image you have of the titan and how it should look like up to the point where you are satisfied with your titan. The titan will of course also have the name of your choice.
We are a small indie team of 2 students exploding with ideas beyond the mainstream, we want to enrich the world with unusual, experimental and beautiful games, leaving the gamer with a truly new experience.
Here is a very brief introduction of ourselves:
He is creating and representing the Soul of ESSENCE, building all these worlds, filling life in every corner, creating mysteries and ornamenting huge and little anomalous entities, edifying the gigantic and unknown structures with the ardent desire to fulfill something that you have never seen and felt.
He is creating and representing the Heart of ESSENCE, filling the objects and entities with life and a character. He breathes life into the worlds and their riddles with purpose and function, entangled moments into a story in which you're going to immerse. Besides he is providing people constantly with new information and handles the numbers.
Together we have been inspired by games like the Zelda series, ICO, the Metroid series and Shadow of the Colossus in early age. Today we are inspired by games like Journey, NaissanceE and The Talos Principle. It has always been our dream to create games like this, and maybe we can even reach another level of those particular kind of games in the future.
We are working like 24/7 on ESSSENCE for around 8 months now. But as we love the project and are good friends for a long time already we have a lot of fun while working on game, but this is just the beginning and there is plenty of work to do and new horizions to be discoverd. Our team is very new and ESSENCE is our first bigger game. So there is a certain risk, but as germans and aspiring developer we stand by our word to build up the future of ONEVISION GAMES. 
Before ESSENCE we have already developed several other little games and prototypes and are thus familiar with the workflow of unity. Alone in the last year we learned a lot, trough working on the game itself and trough the shared experience with other people, and developers. We have improved our efficiency for the next steps of development and achieved many small successes on the way. We are convinced we are on a very good way with ESSENCE.
Here is a quick overviev how we will split the funding, the numbers may vary slightly over the development but it's nothing special. ;)
 Here we have a rough overview for you how the journey will continue in the coming months, if all goes well. Of course things can change, because in game development something can always get in the way and we will expect some issues to be better prepared. Of course we will always give you updates at first if anything changes!

Now we are at the end and we would like to thank you for taking the time and listening to us. 
Then we want to give a thank you to Jaye Arcuve for creating epic music for the gameplay trailer and the official trailer which introduced the first worlds. And Richard Evans for providing a lot of the in-game music and sounds for the prototype, which helped us a lot to enhance the feeling of the prototype and even shaping the vision of ESSENCE further. 
And finally a special thanks to our family, our friends, our new backers and of course to our lovely pioniers, which were already with us in our first campaign. Thank you so much!

A 22-COLOR WASHED PAGED comic book titled ANTI-ALIASING AWAKENING PT 1. begins the story of AMELIA SKY.
My name is JERMAINE M. BOYD; I'm a scriptwriter and lover of all things literary since I could write my first letter. I've always had an aspiration to work in film, ever since I was five. This dream led me to get my film degree from Columbia in Chicago and then to work on various tv and film sets  such as "E.R", "The Magnificent Seven" and various other independent projects. Now, as I grow older I want to obtain one of my deepest dreams to become a Graphic Novelist.
I have so many stories to tell because I've been writing them since I was little but I wanted to show you one of the biggest, and dearest personal projects I've ever created. I wanted to show you an idea. A thought that became a story and eventually now in my older years has come to life with the help of the amazing up and coming Illustrator MIKE REDMAN, and the editorial assitance and story consulting of Editor M.J. SAAM, known for "Andrew Jackson in Space" "Stronghold" "Xenopians".
This sci-fi/horror series chronicles the life of a young, amnesia stricken Amelia as she awakens in the aftermath of the invasion of Earth from a army of beings called the Shriekers - a race that has survived since the beginning of time, bent on consuming all energies of the universe. As Amelia traverses this terrifying apocalypse she will uncover the horror of who she is and find that she has the power inside of her to save what remains of her world - our world. A world where those who remain will now have to survive at any cost - even if it means killing each other. There will be blood, there will be horror; there will be grisly villains at every turn in Amelia’s journey to become our ultimate super heroine. But there is also beauty and hope in the allies she meets, a new family she obtains along her way. 
Concept Art of Futuristic New York
Concept Art of Futuristic New York #2
This project has been constructed in shards piece by piece. I do have bigger plan for it outside of the graphic novel series. So rest assured old fans, no matter what it’s an idea that will never die. Today, however I’m coming to all of you, asking you to join my idea, my story, and it starts with Issue #1: ANTI-ALIASING AWAKENING PT 1 Your help raising $5,830 dollars will bring Issue #1 to life and I will give you exclusive access to every part of its construction from page one to the end. 
Character Concepts Illustrated By: Mike Redman
Concept Character Art By. Mike Redman
THE SHRIEKERS
As Issue #1 gets under way I want to make sure I keep all of you up to date from start to finish.  In my opinion that means letting all of you in on the ground floor.  I want to give all of you the perspective of the creators.  You'll get to see certain pages in construction, or to better phrase it in processing. 
Preliminary of Page 1 of Issue #1
It all starts with A
The story of Amelia has been an idea I've had since I was very young. Yes, Amelia is a girl but this was what I’ve always intended her to be. When I was a child I didn’t see people through my eyes. I saw them through words. Through words I saw great beauty but also enormous inequalities. Those that most touched my heart were stories I read about the plight of women. As you’ll see a good portion of my characters in my stories are women, why you ask? Because I still believe what I believed when I was a child. The best stories are yet to be told through the lens of great women, heroines and villains.
So, I’m sure you’re asking yourself why should I contribute to this project. I will tell you that you should contribute if you love sci-fi, horror, and drama. You should contribute if you love epic tales with beautiful character development. Ultimately, you should contribute if you want to see a new type of heroine. Characters, that will inspire a new generation of not just women but everyone to hopefully one day reach for the Sky.
Concept Art of Amelia Sky
 -Message from the Creator-
I wanted to be absolutely clear on the maturity level of this story. Amelia Sky exist in a very terrifying, gruesome world there will be blood, and gore. The horror that she'll have to see and endure to become a super heroine will be tremendous. The drama that faces Amelia will be very meaningful. The story is my vision of what would happen if there was no more law or order. A reality of an almost extinct human race driven back to the dormant part of humanity, survivalism.

campaign.story:
Can one girl win a war?
My name is Kano Murasaki, but everyone calls me Risuko.
Risuko follows a young woman along the first dangerous steps to discovering who she truly is. 
Though Japan has been devastated by a century of civil war, Risuko just wants to climb trees. Growing up far from the battlefields and court intrigues, the fatherless girl finds herself pulled into a plot that may reunite Japan -- or may destroy it. She is torn from her home and what is left of her family, but finds new friends at a school that may not be what it seems.
Set in Japan during the Sengoku Jidai — the century-long civil war era — Risuko is a coming-of-age adventure for a young woman adrift in a tumultuous, terrifying world. 
It is the first in a planned four-book series, Seasons of the Sword.
When you support this project, you'll reserve your own copy of the final book in the format of your choice at a discount from the retail price, plus much more!
Stretch goal incentive! For every $100 pledged over $1000, I will share a prequel short story with all backers
Risuko: A Kunoichi Tale
Thank you so much for supporting Risuko!
Green is spring's color
Rain and rebirth flow like joy
Publishing takes cash
It's true. Publishing isn't cheap. While Risuko is nearly finished, I need your help to make the book a reality and to help it find its audience.
Reaching the funding goal will help create an attractive, exciting, historically and culturally accurate thrill-ride of a teen book.
Some things you'll help make happen:
Producing an audiobook
Final fact-checking by a historian (support your local scholar!)
Proofreading
Advance reviews (Yes, disgusting isn't it? Some of the major sources of book reviews charge small publishers simply to be reviewed.)
Inclusion in major catalogues, trade shows, etc.
Thank-you gifts for the Risuko Beta Team (a group of phenomenal teens and adults who are helping me to polish the final book)
Some of those are not very exciting in and of themselves, but they're all essential if we're going to release the best possible book.
Should we surpass the goal, there are a number of would't-it-be-nice options that we'll be able to go for, from presenting the book at cons and festivals to marketing directly to libraries and schools to creating braille and/or large-print editions for the vision-impaired to finding translators for foreign language editions. When we get there, I'll start announcing some stretch goals. :-)
Risuko Title Page
Reasons you should feel proud to be a backer:
You're helping publish an exciting debut novel
You're supporting increased diversity in teen fiction
You're increasing the number of strong female role-models in teen fiction
You're encouraging teens to consider complex moral issues — in the context of an adrenaline-rush story
You're supporting independent (non-corporate) publishing
Teen fantasy/science fiction has long been one of my favorite genres; as I was reading (and loving) the Harry Potter, Artemis Fowl, and Percy Jackson series with my daughters, two questions occurred to me: first, why couldn't historical fiction be as engaging and exciting, and second, why aren't the protagonists girls? 
In the past few years we've seen a number of strong young women headlining popular teen books — but they remain the exception rather than the rule. I'd like to continue chipping away at that imbalance. (My youngest daughter informed me with pride that Risuko passed the Bechdel Test with flying colors. I had to look it up — but was pleased to find that not only was she right, but the book passes the reverse Bechdel. W00t.)
